revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-08 02:29:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)

commit_message:
Implement ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality

For raid deletion, existing delete_virtual_disk functionality is not
freeing up foreign drives and spares, so have added ResetConfig and
ClearForeignConfig functionality for freeing up foreign drives and
spares.

Change-Id: I76390dc4fcf8de2fe5aa3d660f77edcef4a4dec1
(cherry picked from commit 6857a6d000f7e61af872fd782092d5f4341d5f31)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17499, 'name': 'Filippo Inzaghi', 'email': 'zhao.daqing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'qingszhao'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}, {'_account_id': 25402, 'name': 'Francesco Pantano', 'email': 'fpantano@redhat.com', 'username': 'fmount'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-06-13 00:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-06-13 00:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-06-13 00:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-06-13 07:23:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think I hit something else that was required, that's why I went with full records.. This way we'll get broken every time THT uses something new from any of these resources."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-13 10:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

> I think I hit something else that was required, that's why I went
 > with full records.. This way we'll get broken every time THT uses
 > something new from any of these resources.

Please include the full structure, we use a lot more that the cidr and tags:
 - host_routes which are dynamically maintained by neutron [1]
 - We use the mtu value of the ctlplane network\xa0[2]
 - We use the dnsnameservers[3]
 - We use the gateway_ip

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml#L536
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml#L540
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml#L554
[4]\xa0https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml#L529


TBH, I never liked the use of deployed-server for this use case. Instead of the deployed servers we should have a new 'fake-server' heat resource that creates a "server" resource with an actual neutron port. Then after that heat stack is created, the output could be passed to metalsmith to create a server using the neutron port created by heat+neutron. Bypassing the need to clutter the data here with all the network, subnet, port data. We could also include the things to create the isolated networks + ports and have the node provision step image the node + configure networking. Then we could validate all the network connectivity before moving to the step of configuring services on the nodes. Separating the network config/service config like this would seem like a good move based on the number of escalations due to mishaps with forgetting to include net-env/net-isol env files on update etc.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-06-13 13:34:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The reasons we went with this approach (overall, I agree about this patch):

1. It's much easier (no changes to THT at all). Given how many people are involved in this effort, it is a serious argument :(

2. It allows splitting bare metal deployment and stack creation. This is the biggest win from my perspective: operators will be able to finish with bare metal steps before trying any software installation.

3. It paves the way to removing heat if we decide to."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-13 18:37:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The reasons we went with this approach (overall, I agree about this
 > patch):
 > 

My -2 here is because data we use is removed from the network and subnets data. So we should'nt merge this before either that part is reverted, or changed to include the fields we use. Once this is fixed, +2 :)"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-06-13 21:04:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

OK I'll find all the values actually used and add them back. Any chance the -2 could become a -1? That seems more appropriate for the change you're asking for."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-06-13 21:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-13 21:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-13 22:06:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

> OK I'll find all the values actually used and add them back. Any
 > chance the -2 could become a -1? That seems more appropriate for
 > the change you're asking for.

Thanks Steve, I checked and the fields included now should cover what we use."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-14 09:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

check-rdo,

Unrelated error:
https://logs.rdoproject.org/38/665038/4/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset035/fb1eb43/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_prep_images.log.txt.gz#_2019-06-13_22_55_18'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Set resource_registry deployed-server port

Without this the supplied DeployedServerPortMap is ignored and the
wrong IP addresses are used for ansible ssh.

Also, instead of writing out the entire network and subnets data
structure, only render the required values. This makes the result a
bit more readable and maintainable.

Change-Id: I4aa346fa0bbf0e4c591205ae96e4ad03d3b9a04c
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Handle openvswitch meta-package on undercloud upgrade.

As done for the overcloud in [0], we need to include the
same special package handling in the tasks in charge of
upgrading the undercloud.

This patch adds special handling for the rhosp-openvswitch
layered product package to ensure that openvswitch networking
remains available during the upgrade.

[0] - https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1773afb0689c8fded9bce2dff4c1f8d9406c8294

(cherry picked from commit 0d9d92ac58aeae25b8c120ab8ebc2bad7233d9bc)
Change-Id: Ib115e70ce0ce53a8638ccbe6c9fe6ed6a421e09b
Closes-Bug: #1830627

commit_message:
Fixed mistral hanging processing the list of failed actions

Currently it queries all the records instead of filtering. Changed that
into a filter so only relevant action_executions are requested.

External bugzilla bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1718573

Change-Id: Ic8281cf47e587e193efda9dfa509abd16a1cf67e
(cherry picked from commit 3e9b858cf71a17b3e1077c4fc21d51c2aa23ba2e)

commit_message:
Improve docker API version retrieval

The current method does not work due to CLI output formatting
changes. We improve it to render the client output using toml,
which should be more future proof.

This change also disables pinging of the neutron router during
tempest tests, a combined patch is required to pass tests.

Change-Id: I7f611ffd095ca690baba3a987d8eb0b8407fade1

commit_message:
Remove reference to deprecated attribute

The node['openstack']['api']['auth']['version'] was deprecated and should no
longer be used. Default to version 3 for keystone since that's currently what's
supported.

Change-Id: I655e19e31f026be4fe92cbfbbf9d41f37cc6208d
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

commit_message:
Restrict cliff to <2.15.0

Using Kayobe with cliff 2.15.0 fails with the following error:

kayobe playbook run playbook.yml
invalid conflict_resolution value: 'ignore'

This change restricts cliff to <2.15.0.

Change-Id: I7966cf33f6133090d83232504b8c1da4c7817e0c
Story: 2005891
Task: 33748

commit_message:
Switch RHEL to using distribution packages for rabbitmq

Installing rabbitmq without using the distro version is failing and it works if
you use the distro version. So let's standardize on that for both ubuntu and
RHEL.

Change-Id: If757cf57574bb8389ae270523bfc3772d8dc08db
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

messages: [{'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-16 02:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-16 05:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30417, 'date': '2019-06-17 17:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-17 17:57:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-16 02:09:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix gnocchi endpoint issues

This fixes two primary issues:

- Removal of using node['openstack']['api']['auth']['version'] and converting to
  using ::URI.decode
- Renaming endpoint attributes from telemetry-metric to telemetry_metric to
  match what's used in openstack-common

Change-Id: I59c960a18f9e88eea494ec3c7bdbf189309f23e7
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>
"}, {'created': '2019-06-16 05:57:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix gnocchi endpoint issues

This fixes two primary issues:

- Removal of using node['openstack']['api']['auth']['version'] and converting to
  using ::URI.decode
- Renaming endpoint attributes from telemetry-metric to telemetry_metric to
  match what's used in openstack-common. Also rename all attributes to using the
  underscore to minimize confusion.

Change-Id: I59c960a18f9e88eea494ec3c7bdbf189309f23e7
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gnocchi endpoint issues

This fixes two primary issues:

- Removal of using node['openstack']['api']['auth']['version'] and converting to
  using ::URI.decode
- Renaming endpoint attributes from telemetry-metric to telemetry_metric to
  match what's used in openstack-common. Also rename all attributes to using the
  underscore to minimize confusion.

Change-Id: I59c960a18f9e88eea494ec3c7bdbf189309f23e7
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 20:35:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix Snapshot object metadata loading

The Snapshot object will fail to correctly load
metadata.  Initialize the object fully so that

commit_message:
Fix Snapshot object metadata loading

The Snapshot object will fail to correctly load
metadata.  Initialize the object fully so that
obj_what_changed() works as intended.

This prevents the error:
   AttributeError: 'Snapshot' object has no
   attribute '_obj_metadata'

Closes-Bug: #1805790

Co-Author: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idee4836ee3e4f9b9f4099e7a1a3d7a4bada3f7b8

commit_message:
Fix git cloning previous release repos in CI

Zuul provides repositories with all branches containing all prospective
changes, not just the current branch. We can use this in the upgrade
jobs to include changes to the previous release branch when a patch
depends on them.

Change-Id: I24564160b2e8f7c5feef7745fffb73de871018cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 12:35:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix Windows support

A recent commit [1] broke Windows support by using shlex to
unquote paths.

The issue with shlex.split is that it doesn't work with Windows
paths, treating backslashes as escape characters.

We'll just replace backslashes with slashes before using shlex.split,
converting them back afterwards.

Closes-Bug: #1831242

[1] Id2cc32e4e40c1f834b19756e922118d8526358d3

Change-Id: Icb3abca004a35ab9760db8116fedfa96d012d0d0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Windows support

A recent commit [1] broke Windows support by using shlex to
unquote paths.

The issue with shlex.split is that it doesn't work with Windows
paths, treating backslashes as escape characters.

We'll just replace backslashes with slashes before using shlex.split,
converting them back afterwards.

Closes-Bug: #1831242

[1] Id2cc32e4e40c1f834b19756e922118d8526358d3

Change-Id: Icb3abca004a35ab9760db8116fedfa96d012d0d0

commit_message:
Add higher retry/delay defaults to check the quorum status.

As the lp1832597 reported, we need to push to ceph-ansible
higher values to check if the quorum is healthy after the
handler is executed.
This commit sets new defaults via CephAnsibleExtraConfig.

Change-Id: If5b39c78b32f7312ea0b5056a7d4ec3a60ee931d
Related-Bug: 1832597

commit_message:
Use Undercloud local_ip to ensure the registry does answer or not

The Container registry vhost should listen on the Undercloud local_ip
instead of the loopback address.

This patch gets the local_ip of the Undercloud from the undercloud.conf
file to verify if the image-serve service is working and answering.

Change-Id: I8c49001acdf33192d93113e5721f6e9b1aca73f1
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ee1cec4804949d5b415146c093e881dc9df6c38c)

commit_message:
Configure server_certs_key_passphrase for Octavia

A recent change[1] to Octavia added a parameter named
server_certs_key_passphrase, which means that TripleO should
generate a password for it to avoid using the default value.

This patch adds OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase to the list
of parameters TripleO configures in Octavia.

Conflicts:
      ci/environments/scenario010-standalone.yaml
      deployment/octavia/octavia-base.yaml
      environments/services/octavia.yaml

Note that octavia-base.yaml exists under puppet/services since
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/638762 got merged in
stable/stein.

Closes-Bug: #1821756
Related-Bug: #1821751

commit_message:
Configure server_certs_key_passphrase for Octavia

A recent change[1] to Octavia added a parameter named
server_certs_key_passphrase, which means that TripleO should
generate a password for it to avoid using the default value.

This patch adds OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase to the list
of parameters TripleO configures in Octavia.

Conflicts:
      ci/environments/scenario010-standalone.yaml
      deployment/octavia/octavia-base.yaml
      environments/services/octavia.yaml

Note that octavia-base.yaml exists under puppet/services since
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/638762 got merged in
stable/stein.

Closes-Bug: #1821756
Related-Bug: #1821751

commit_message:
Fix NovaNfs role parameters

This I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e introduces bug
which breaks NFS for Nova. The NFS task in in host_prep_tasks
did not run because we did not meet the nfs_backend_enable|bool
condition.

Closes-Bug: #1832850

Change-Id: Id918080bf0817ce24eb4abe716a4f1b1375c236d
(cherry picked from commit 60248889a59957c1b323ce6a9859d56eb78cfce3)
(cherry picked from commit 247e8e86f31b48f85e849d242f3a31f99ccc7665)
(cherry picked from commit fbd3638e2d97b889de9ae022d76c65360d9d8bd9)

commit_message:
Add pkg names better management between OS releases

The check-latest-minor-version role checks if the latest minor version
of python-tripleoclient rpm is installed on the Undercloud. But now, the
package is called python2-tripleoclient on RHEL/CentOS 7 and
python3-tripleoclient on RHEL 8 and it should be the same on the future
CentOS 8.

This patch fixes the naming issue across the supported OS.

Change-Id: If4aeeca507abc1aee3e783a25fb325e53152753e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 306f531c1c67c9540f36040ff71905dd228d1497)

Skip running tripleo on lower-constraint changes

We don't need to run any tripleo jobs on the lower-constraints changes,
so let's skip that one.

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Ie8646a08c430a1d660a00595545c6de8221319d3

Include requirements.txt in testenv deps

Projects generally need both requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
for running their unit tests.

commit_message:
Remove nova-consoleauth

The nova-consoleauth service was deprecated during the Rocky release [1]
and has not been necessary since unless you're using cells v1. As Kolla
has never supported cells v1, which is finally being removed during
Train [2], we can get ahead of the curve and stop deploying
nova-consoleauth immediately.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/implemented/convert-consoles-to-objects.html
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/remove-cells-v1/

Change-Id: I099080979f5497537e390f531005a517ab12aa7a

subject: Add Placement service to Minimal deployment for Stein
messages:
[{'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2019-06-06 02:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-07 11:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

yup, nova requires placement'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-06-10 12:42:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

While we have a placement install guide for Stein, I would also like to see these docs updated before this is merged:
1. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/openstack-services.html#minimal-deployment-for-stein
2. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/environment-networking-compute.html
3. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/overview.html#example-architecture

I'm not entirely sure we should be adding this to the minimal deployment before we have verified documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/placement/stein/install/ it's something to say that it NEEDS to work together, but if a user can't get the config right, then it's alllll broken.

I think we also need to be updating: https://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator/openstack-components#openstack-services"}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-06-10 12:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-10 12:45:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not entirely sure we should be adding this to the minimal
 > deployment before we have verified documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/placement/stein/install/
 > it's something to say that it NEEDS to work together, but if a user
 > can't get the config right, then it's alllll broken.

I agree that the docs need work across several dimensions, but the simple fact is that nova can't work without placement installed (since something like ocata or pike) so we need to highlight that, here. It's only since stein that it is separate, however."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-06-10 12:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, I should also mention: the warning on the top of https://docs.openstack.org/placement/stein/install/ was put there because none of the distros produced any verification of that information despite multiple promptings.

https://docs.openstack.org/placement/stein/install/from-pypi.html is known to work well. There others are best guesses.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-06-10 14:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I'm not entirely sure we should be adding this to the minimal
 > > deployment before we have verified documentation:
 > https://docs.openstack.org/placement/stein/install/
 > > it's something to say that it NEEDS to work together, but if a
 > user
 > > can't get the config right, then it's alllll broken.
 > 
 > I agree that the docs need work across several dimensions, but the
 > simple fact is that nova can't work without placement installed
 > (since something like ocata or pike) so we need to highlight that,
 > here. It's only since stein that it is separate, however.

Makes sense. This as a doc update, and if you're going to update that placement is required I think we really need to ensure that 1,2,3 (obviously this is 1) is completed on the list I provided.
Plus I think it's worth updating the project navigator as a larger part of this change. The docs and what's on the official website should reflect each other."}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2019-06-11 04:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> 1. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/openstack-services.html#minimal-deployment-for-stein
 > 2. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/environment-networking-compute.html
 > 3. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/overview.html#example-architecture

This patch updates 1. I understand we should update 3, but can not understand 2. Are you assuming "Placement node"? Could you point out in detail?'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-06-11 15:34:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > 1. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/openstack-services.html#minimal-deployment-for-stein
 > > 2. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/environment-networking-compute.html
 > > 3. https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/overview.html#example-architecture
 > 
 > This patch updates 1. I understand we should update 3, but can not
 > understand 2. Are you assuming "Placement node"? Could you point
 > out in detail?

I admit I just went through the docs and found all the locations I felt it would be best updated other than just 1. 
2 was a concern for any configuration details that are required. Although I admit re-reading I am not particularly sure why I thought this was relevant... commit_message:
Add Placement service to Minimal deployment for Stein

Placement service installation is removed in nova installation since Stein.
This patch adds Placement service to Minimal deployment for Stein.

Change-Id: Ia91d2abe303ce18f9eb392ca4db2be64df79e1d6
Closes-Bug: #1831822

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-17 10:19:14.000000000', 'message': 'Uniquify allocation mappings

When creating the allocation mappings output, use a set() not a
list() so that any single resource provider only shows up once.
The initial implementation (at
Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303) allowed a provider to
show up multiple times if it contributed more than one class
of inventory.

This slipped through because of a missing test. A test that covers
the issue is added.k

Change-Id: If00f01534b7d0ec84ca8abaeef5b90a16cbcffc3
'}]
commit_message:
Uniquify allocation mappings

When creating the allocation mappings output, use a set() not a
list() so that any single resource provider only shows up once.
The initial implementation (at
Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303) allowed a provider to
show up multiple times if it contributed more than one class
of inventory.

This slipped through because of a missing test. A test that covers
the issue is added.k

Change-Id: If00f01534b7d0ec84ca8abaeef5b90a16cbcffc3

commit_message:
Ensure controllers all call super

Currently some do and some don't. Do it by default as intended. We also
remove the 'view_builder' argument from the base 'Controller.__init__'
function since nothing was actually setting this.

Change-Id: Ic0b16608078e4545f546509df94caba3166ed6e2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Thank you Ilya. May be a naive question. How do we find out the field is 'Optional' or 'Required' from [1]. I could gather following information, my interpretation may be incorrect...
As per [2] ' 'Required properties' are referred in section 7.5.4.5 which says such properties can be indicated with Nullable attribute with a value of "false".
Using definition in [2], I was referring [3] which indicates 'Actions' as required as it has "Nullable=false" 

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/Manager.v1_5_1.json
[2] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.0.html

commit_message:
Make Manager->Actions field optional

Redfish schema does not require Actions field to be
present [1].

1. https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/Manager.v1_5_1.json

Change-Id: Ic9402f7639a561b88c4a9be91d1c6c88c6b12c31

We were installing 5.2.4 version instead of just latest one like it is
done on x86-64.

subject: [neutron] Do not migrate all subprojects
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'marcin.juszkiewicz+kolla@linaro.org', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 29100, 'name': 'Jason Anderson', 'email': 'jasonanderson@uchicago.edu', 'username': 'jasonanderson'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-16 08:19:36.000000000', 'message': '[neutron] Do not migrate all subprojects

Instead of migrating all Neutron subprojects at bootstrap time, target
specifically the neutron, neutron-fwaas, and neutron-vpnaas subprojects
speficially. If a subproject is not specified, all subprojects are
migrated, which is not the intended behavior.

Change-Id: Icb8d572b7f084804e0423a8a3171dd66646b3885
(cherry picked from commit f36d7aacf28bc75a4b0ece73b45aa09591cd262c)
'}]
commit_message:
[neutron] Do not migrate all subprojects

Instead of migrating all Neutron subprojects at bootstrap time, target
specifically the neutron, neutron-fwaas, and neutron-vpnaas subprojects
speficially. If a subproject is not specified, all subprojects are
migrated, which is not the intended behavior.

Change-Id: Icb8d572b7f084804e0423a8a3171dd66646b3885
(cherry picked from commit f36d7aacf28bc75a4b0ece73b45aa09591cd262c)

commit_message:
Revert "docker/compose: quote health-cmd"

This reverts commit 9fbbad559dcffaf4d57c5c1c244db3b80e09106c.
This patch was wrong. We don't need the quotes because
we use subprocess and the args aren't parsed lie on
bash.

Change-Id: I47a6dd2f57809c02d57b0772e6c17150cb6687b3
Related-Bug: #1824808

commit_message:
Add devstack spawn logging for sample templates

By default this logging is disabled.
Its very useful to have devstack spawn logs so
it should be enabled.

Change-Id: Ic8ed865aeeba087ee02f7db159af5eb29580ce65

commit_message:
OVS Revalidator and handler threads config

OVS revalidator hanlder threads are not contained to limited cores.
This patch will enable them to be configured in puppet vswitch module

Change-Id: I576b00bb28d0d531eb91a856632a7b5afe552f43
Closes-Bug: #1822571
(cherry picked from commit 6bc5b206e72409baf6dc9883d0e4789a7155bbb0)

commit_message:
systemd should recover Keepalived

Currently, haproxy gets recovered by systemd, but keepalived does not.
We know Octavia can recover from such scenario by swapping the failed
Amphora, yet in a case where systemd can assist here, it will recover
much faster.

This patch modifies the keepalived systemd unit file as follows:

KillMode=mixed (was: process)
Restart=always

Story: 2003308
Task: 24263

Change-Id: I0e5a358c5f7b631646d8cca2ff5b86181ad19169

commit_message:
Allow mitral-executor to perform undercloud backups

This patch adds possibility to :
  - execute mysqldump by installing the mariadb/mysql-client
  - execute sudo in mistral_executor on chown and tar explicitly
    just for the backup purposes by adding sudoers file

Partial-Bug: #1812960
Change-Id: I67899db3c1f4197210bc362a8f944529a3a7b2b3

commit_message:
Remove faulty placement::config leftovers

Remove the leftover auth parameters in placement::config.

These are from the puppet-nova extraction and should not be
set in the placement section in placement's configuration file
since there is none.

This patch makes sure they are removed from the configuration
file to make sure deployments doesn't have auth config's laying
around that should not be there.

Change-Id: Ifacef570b2296b1b62c75d850c6059562ec4cb1c

subject: Improve performance on get and create/update/delete requests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 12907, 'name': 'Jan Zerebecki', 'email': 'jan.openstack@zerebecki.de', 'username': 'jzerebecki'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 23709, 'name': 'Duc Truong', 'email': 'dkt26111@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtruong'}, {'_account_id': 25674, 'name': 'Jude Cross', 'email': 'jucross@blizzard.com', 'username': 'problem_v'}, {'_account_id': 28377, 'name': 'Julien Carpentier', 'email': 'carpentier.julien@gmail.com', 'username': 'jiteka'}, {'_account_id': 28502, 'name': 'Colin Gibbons', 'email': 'cgibbons@blizzard.com', 'username': 'colin'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-02-05 23:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-02-05 23:48:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This patch improves the performance on create operation (most noticeably with member create), as well as all get operations (most noticeably with loadbalancer show). In my testing the calls dropped from ~40s down to ~1s, especially when involving load balancers with 400+ members.

The most noticeably culprit in my testing was _get_driver_for_loadbalancer, as it would pull down and build everything for that loadbalancer, this was particularity painful with 400+ members.

Having that said, this patch is largely focused on our use case, and I have currently not applied this to other api calls (e.g. L7 rules).

If anyone else wants to contribute to this patch, feel free to do so, as I don't know if I will have the time to push it enough to get it merged."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-02-06 01:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Improve performance on get and create/update/delete requests

This change follows up on the previous performance improvements
and does the same for crud requests.
I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e

We remove from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from the get_loabalancer, get_pool, get_listener,
get_healthmonitor, get_l7policy, get_l7policy_rule,
get_pool_member.

Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entirely skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

This is in particular important on calls like _get_driver_for_loadbalancer
as it previously would load the loadbalancer and all related objects
just to get the provider name for the loadbalancer.

Story: 2004949
Task: 29365

Change-Id: Ic268ea3cdcf809f62ba1ab3ebf8ab6d22f871404

commit_message:
Revert "docker/compose: quote health-cmd"

This reverts commit 9fbbad559dcffaf4d57c5c1c244db3b80e09106c.
This patch was wrong. We don't need the quotes because
we use subprocess and the args aren't parsed lie on
bash.

Change-Id: I066fb243caa7f9fd819a7f91c47857b3aa678807
Related-Bug: #1824808

commit_message:
Allow specifying destination for cold migrations

This was added in microversion 2.56 but was not previously exposed in
OSC. Close this gap.

Change-Id: I22d37059231a009c91150ad2f494f21ea188f9cf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enhance Storage models to support RAID config

The Storage, Volume, and Drive resource models are enhanced to enable
the implementation of RAID configuration management.

Change-Id: Ia1ba7f08c6574c7497ca7464a52f46a5b72bc0cd
Story: 2003514
Task: 30593

commit_message:
Fix bare reference of cinder_enable_iscsi_backend

Ansible is throwing a deprecation warning for this so we need to add a
|bool to the usage of cinder_enable_iscsi_backend

Change-Id: If536dbc8ace915d171a23e289da2777e74dc3b27
Related-Bug: #1832402

commit_message:
Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health

Currently the amphora-agent is not reporting UDP listener health
when the UDP listener does not have a pool and members.
This patch changes that behavior to report the listener as healthy
if the keepalived process is started and running in the amphora.

This patch also introduces message versioning for the health
heartbeat messages.

It also corrects a few assertEqual tests that had the reference and
actual values backwards.

Change-Id: Ifc28b4991852e59c0d27b4ab3d1afc4e9965e88b
Story: 2003592
Task: 24911

commit_message:
Disable iscsi.service to avoid iscsid on host from getting started

When some stale shutdown happens on the node, iscsi.service detects
remaining information about iscsi connection, and recovers connections
based on the information, with starting iscsid service on host.
This causes a collision between iscsid on host and iscsid in container,
which makes iscsid container keep restarting.

This patch makes sure that iscsi.service on host is disabled
when we deploy iscsid container, to avoid iscsid on host is started
unexpectedly.

Change-Id: I6c36cd15edfa53c3c76be9095ff40cecf451490d
Closes-Bug: #1833019

commit_message:
db_setup: refactor database setup to a common file

This patch refactors the database creation to db_setup.yml which
will eventually be managed by openstack-ansible-tests.

This also re-orders the mq_setup to be done earlier so these system
level dependencies are ready before service activation.

Change-Id: If399f3a515b0f3306819c23f1f62bc1b6ee0ea32

commit_message:
Fixed renaming topic breaking service

Changing the topic currently changes the service_name. This
breaks the service, as the service_name is also used to
load the appropriate configuration seection for the service.

> self._service_config = CONF['service:%s' % self.service_name]

* Renames cfg option [service:<name>].<name>_topic to [service:<name>].topic
* Removed previously unused configs related to topics.
* Added topic override for producer.
* Added test coverage.

Closes-Bug: #1832799
Change-Id: I16385361ec25025aa533df80793dfc4d22151cbb

subject: Rename `drivers` to `resources/systems`
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}, {'_account_id': 26340, 'name': 'Ilya Etingof', 'email': 'etingof@gmail.com', 'username': 'etingof'}, {'_account_id': 28935, 'name': '98k', 'email': '18552437190@163.com', 'username': '98k'}, {'_account_id': 29209, 'name': 'Dhanuka Warusadura', 'email': 'csx@tuta.io', 'username': 'dnuka'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-21 19:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-22 10:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

While we're bikeshedding, I'd prefer "backend" :)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:01:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> While we're bikeshedding, I'd prefer "backend" :)

The problem with the original "backend" is that we are going to have more of those. Another backend will be modeling the BMC itself, then another for the chassis...'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-25 20:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM. One note, we'll likely need to do a major release due to the main.py method name change, but I think that is fine for this."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-28 16:07:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

To be honest, I don't see a point in this whole patch chain, unless we can make virtual media actually work with libvirt/openstack. The latter may be possible, but I'm pretty much against having a dummy Manager implementation. In the end, we need to test virtual media in the CI, and that requires it to actually work."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-28 16:35:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> To be honest, I don't see a point in this whole patch chain, unless we can make virtual media actually work with libvirt/openstack.

Right, this is the whole purpose of this patch chain. I am working on manager simulation which boots libvirt-backed system.

Going forward, considering the Redfish data model pillars being systems, chassis and managers, it seems logical to me to have separate driver abstractions for each of these entities because they are different (e.g. it seems artificial to mimic chassis with libvirt)."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-28 16:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If we assume that e.g. Managers interact with Systems (which is the case for virtual media), how would you have different backends for them? Imagine using a libvirt Manager backend with an openstack System backend..'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-28 17:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> If we assume that e.g. Managers interact with Systems (which is the case for virtual media), how would you have different backends for them? Imagine using a libvirt Manager backend with an openstack System backend..

Right, that's not the goal.

My understanding is that Manager is a separate entity in its own right, which can  interact with Systems and Chassis, but can also do its own stuff.

That's why I propose to model Chassis, Managers and Systems separately, as opposed to modeling Managers and Chassis on top of Systems. 

By modeling I mean mapping Redfish documents onto something. With Systems we map onto libvirt or nova instance state. With Managers and Chassis I do not know yet what would model these entities reasonably close. That's why it's static configuration for system-independent items and calls to the system driver for system-related things."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-01 10:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-16 12:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-16 12:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Sorry, after reading other patches in the chain, I'm again not convinced we should do it. I'd rather have manager methods on the driver, and only make systems-vs-manager split virtual. E.g. a System <uuid> is served by a Manager <uuid>, while actually everything comes from the same driver.

I also don't see point in a fake virtual media. We have static emulator for that."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-16 12:56:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Sorry, after reading other patches in the chain, I'm again not convinced we should do it. I'd rather have manager methods on the driver, and only make systems-vs-manager split virtual. E.g. a System <uuid> is served by a Manager <uuid>, while actually everything comes from the same driver.

So what's your rationale for representing Managers by the Systems driver? I'm reading through this conversation, but struggling to understand the reasoning for that.

Perhaps you consider systems-only design from the practical standpoint i.e. currently  Managers do not have any features other than VirtualMedia:

> If we assume that e.g. Managers interact with Systems (which is the case for virtual media), how would you have different backends for them? Imagine using a libvirt Manager backend with an openstack System backend..

My concern here is that despite the fact that Managers do interact with Systems, conceptually, they are entities of their own. Representing BMCs, they may exist even without Systems or they can interact with other entities but Systems (e.g. Chassis). On top of that, Redfish model is open-ended meaning that Managers (representing BMCs) can get brand new BMC-specific features either through new releases of standard schema or OEM extensions.

For example: with composable hardware IIRC you may end up without any System at hand (because you decomposed them), but Managers are still there.

That makes me think that merging two representations of conceptually independent entities into one model might complicate things once we advance in other Managers features simulation...

At the same time, I do not see the benefits of systems-only design right now, even before we have lesser Systems-focused features implemented in the Managers."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-16 14:00:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> So what's your rationale for representing Managers by the Systems driver?

That's the key disagreement here: I only see one driver, "the sushy backend". I don't see managers and systems separate because they're not actually orthogonal. If they were, you could use e.g. OpenStack Systems driver with Libvirt Managers driver. You cannot, they're tightly coupled.

> My concern here is that despite the fact that Managers do interact with Systems, conceptually, they are entities of their own.

Conceptually - yes. And honestly this is a weird bit of the standard, because a virtual media ISO is connected to a system in reality. And while a manager can manage several systems, it makes no sense whatsoever with virtual media (and consoles). I think virtual media and consoles belong to System resource, but we have what we have :('}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-21 14:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-21 14:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-21 17:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-21 17:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-22 12:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-26 09:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I still see this work as unnecessary over-engineered.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-26 10:52:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> I still see this work as unnecessary over-engineered.

Well, I am still not convinced that fighting the abstractions of the standard (no matter how mistaken it appears to us) may not be fruitful in the long run...

I am now mostly focused on getting virtual media boot operational with ironic. Code-wise it's easy to merge managers and systems (and chassis?) into one Python class, if the community wants it that way."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-26 11:24:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

It's not about fighting the standard, it's about designing the internals that make sense in our case. I can easily believe that in quite some cases the split between Managers and Systems make sense. I'm not convinced it makes any sense in our case, where we have just 2 backends that are already known to not have a separate Manager entity."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-03-29 15:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-01 15:22:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

Same comment as above. I would be less picky, but this series introduces ~1000 loc diff just for the fake virtual media implementation that we're not going to use."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-04-17 12:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-04-23 12:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-04-24 10:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-04-26 16:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-04-29 10:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-06-05 18:45:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

I'm a little confused as to the complete why, but also mentally I recognize that structurally these are different areas and it is likely much cleaner to go down this path.

With that said, LGTM. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-06-11 10:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2

I kind of have the same thoughts as Julia
I'm for moving forward with this"}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-06-17 13:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Rename `drivers` to `resources/systems`

This change internally renames backend `drivers` abstraction to
`resources/systems` drivers to set the stage for clear separation
of independently emulated resources.

This change is proposed in preparation of the upcoming Redfish
"Managers", "Chassis", "VirtualMedia" and "IndicatorLED"
resources implementation.

No user-visible changes should be caused by this modification.

Change-Id: I811aa18b7c55b1f9b573f7fcc479edf3619742e3

commit_message:
Fix auto setup Barbican's ACL in the legacy driver.

Add calls barbican legacy driver for set_acl and unset_acl actions when
using certificates in a container.

Change-Id: I7984c85ec98b6b8df00db1b2c58ddc067508b1a5
Story: 2003905

commit_message:
Add automatic documentation for new roles

When new roles are created following the contributing process,
documentation will now be automatically generated using the
role itself as content.

The automatic documentation process has been added to the
role-addition.yml playbook making it easy for developers to
get started.

Change-Id: Idba128e441a1a4fdff30ff1b9105f7ca8d199345
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Add releasentoes and documentation jobs

This change adds documentation and releaseonte jobs which will
validate docs written and publish them as needed.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Cleanup ConfFixture
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-12 00:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-06-12 16:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2019-06-13 14:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-06-14 09:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks. Could you find the history when import_opt was removed?. I want to learn it.'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-06-14 11:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28543, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-06-16 08:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-17 13:48:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Could you find the history when import_opt was removed?. I want to learn it.

The import_opt statements were added the conf_fixture module in 6a55914b05c77f7e7fd3e95ce5ce65954939d314 which was 4 years ago and maybe necessary at the time, but reading https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/9c71b0140931b51ffffc3bbdc1b655fdaccce45b/oslo_config/cfgfilter.py it sounds like you'd use import_opt if you wanted to enforce explicitly declaring and restricting which options you're going to use from an external dependency, and watcher isn't using ConfigFilter so the import_opt statements are unnecessary. The original change that used them didn't mention why they were needed either (this is why it's good to have code comments for this kind of stuff when it's added - so people 4 years later have an idea what it was for)."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 00:20:17.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup ConfFixture

This makes the ConfFixture extend the Config fixture from
oslo.config which handles cleanup for us. The module level
import_opt calls are also removed since they are no longer
needed.

Change-Id: I869e89c53284c8da45e0b1293f2d35011f5bfbf9
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup ConfFixture

This makes the ConfFixture extend the Config fixture from
oslo.config which handles cleanup for us. The module level
import_opt calls are also removed since they are no longer
needed.

Change-Id: I869e89c53284c8da45e0b1293f2d35011f5bfbf9

commit_message:
Remove ipxe tags when ipx6 is in use.

Turns out the dhcp server doesn't always do the right thing
and our duplicated tags seem to create confusion. So lets
remove them so ipxe6 will work.

Change-Id: I446cb814ae41cfd1e9a4ed45f27dac17e9b5bb61
Story: 2005885
Task: 33734

[{'created': '2019-06-12 14:49:11.000000000', 'message': 'Increase timeout of temp swift URLs from 1 to 4 hours

It can take longer than 1 hour for a temporary swift
URL which stores the backup of the fetch directory to
be created vs used. Increase the timeout from 1 hour
to 4 hours so that the URL does not expire before it
is used.

Change-Id: Ib989bd673c694a9dc5af2a4a63ed84888f102a50
Fixes-Bug: #1832509
'}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout of temp swift URLs from 1 to 4 hours

It can take longer than 1 hour for a temporary swift
URL which stores the backup of the fetch directory to
be created vs used. Increase the timeout from 1 hour
to 4 hours so that the URL does not expire before it
is used.

Change-Id: Ib989bd673c694a9dc5af2a4a63ed84888f102a50
Fixes-Bug: #1832509

commit_message:
Document dev_mode for container image prepare

- Update the container image prepare document for dev mode install:
  https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image#dev-install

- Update standalone manual to refer to the container image prepare page
  for special needs during a standalone deployment.

Change-Id: I666dc2b00ebbe56d957526a2a0b1966ddfcdfcf7

commit_message:
Fix non-interactive mode for apt

Since sudo was laucnhed after setting DEBIAN_FRONTEND variable,
noninteractive wasn't working correctly during bindep installation.

Also patch includes temporary fix which is generally adressed in [1]
This is implemented to resolve cross-dependency and will be rolled
back once general fix will land.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/665244/

Change-Id: I44c6aa7a0266285ca67edca70cdc4450c64671d9
(cherry picked from commit 1084ff6d5acab882de1a361fc4144ec0630f520d)

commit_message:
Avoid gather_facts is not a valid attribute for a IncludeRole

Ansible 2.7 no longer accepts use of gather_facts as attribute for
include role.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650169

'}, {'created': '2019-04-26 04:44:40.000000000', 'message': "Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

Note that this depends on a tempest change because the test_novnc tests
make assumptions about how noVNC works and need to be updated in order
to handle the 'path' query parameter.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/655827

Closes-Bug: #1822676

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b
"}, {'created': '2019-06-14 18:01:33.000000000', 'message': "Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Remove remanents of 'build_sphinx' usage

We no longer build docs with setuptools (or pbr) but rather by calling
'sphinx-build' directly. However, we have stuff left over from the days
before this switch. Remove them.

Change-Id: I185005c61c3269f9b1e96d28376ae67b7f7a7463
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix TCP listener logging bug

HAProxy is not handling two of the HTTP log format variables correct
when the load balancer has a TCP listener.
This patch corrects that problem.

Change-Id: I2eb8a0b5de46ee56321bc0009b6ca2b3ad4caebf

commit_message:
Increase request timeout for sidecar

By default sidecar timeout to authenticate to Keystone
is set to 5 seconds.

In most of the cases 5 seconds is enough but depending
the environment, the authentication complexity, etc...
it could be too short.

Change-Id: I02146bc67ec783786aa280f7759623abeb84bd21
Story: 2005769
Task: 33486

commit_message:
NUMACell, InstanceNUMACell: Adopt 'PCPU' changes

This patch makes 'NUMACell' and 'InstanceNUMACell' object ready
to accept 'PCPU'.

NOTE:
These changes are unused until the code which stores PCPU into
NUMACell and InstanceNUMACell is merged.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources
Change-Id: If7407709104497d686bde8466ca6d56be9147e6e

subject: PCPU: Define numa dedicated CPU resource class

(3 comments)

> I thought we agreed to rename existing NUMA_CORES to PCPU rather than adding a new PCPU resource class?

I don't think we can remove an old resource class without more careful consideration, because non-Nova placement consumers could theoretically be using it.  Whatever we decide on that, we shouldn't do it in this patch.  (Note that Jay's os-resource-classes strawperson [1] provides a path for deprecating resource classes.)

The argument might be made that we should freeze ResourceClass and do any future work in os-resource-classes [1], but I don't think we're far enough along developing that concept to make it worthwhile waiting.  Note also [2] which is doing this same thing for bandwidth resource classes.

TL;DR, I think we should do this here & now as written.

Downvote is for the missing resource-classes-policy.yaml update, which will make this bounce once rebased.

[1] https://github.com/jaypipes/os-resource-classes/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570847/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570847/10/nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/gabbits/resource-classes-policy.yaml"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-15 20:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-15 20:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
PCPU: Define numa dedicated CPU resource class

This patch adds PCPU resource class representing an amount of
dedicated CPUs for a single guest.

There will be a series of patches to simplify the quantitative
tracking of dedicated CPU resources consistent with the tracking
of shared CPU resources via the placement API.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I0e5346547c0490265fdc2edc33d84567bcef7cb2

subject: Implement allocation candidate mappings

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-30 15:35:29.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Implement allocation candidate mappings

In microversion 1.34 add a 'mappings' key to each allocation
request. It's value is dict keyed by resource group suffixes
with values of a list of resource providers satisfying that
group.

Posted early to get some feedback on if it is the right thing.

It is a WIP because:

* The spec has not merged.
* No api-ref, rest history or reno updates
* The tests are too limited and need a variety of things, in
  particular exercising nested (rather than shared) granular queries.
  It's as yet unconfirmed if the right suffix will be carried through
  the candidate expansion and collapse that happens.
* Incoming allocation schema are not updated to accept (but ignore) the
  mappings key.

Note that I hadn't intended to do this, I was simply doing some
exploratory warmup exercises to prep for the various nested magic
things, and this just sort of fell out. Tetsuro's RequestSearchContext
helped greatly. I suspect that the suffix could have been available
in other ways, but putting it on the context placed it where we want
it.

Change-Id: Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303
Story: 2005575
Task: 33536

commit_message:
Implement allocation candidate mappings

In microversion 1.34 add a 'mappings' key to each allocation
request. Its value is dict keyed by resource group suffixes
with values of a list of resource providers satisfying that
group.

To preserve symmetry, the mappings key may be sent back when
writing allocations so the schema for POST and PUT allocations
and POST /reshaper are updated.

api history, api-ref and reno are added

Change-Id: Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303
Story: 2005575
Task: 33536

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 14:11:17.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that get_host_ip() is mocked out in test

The test test_setup_ufw() didn't mock out get_host_ip() which meant that
the test leaked and used an actual IP hostname lookup.  This failed when
ubuntu.com's IP address changed.  This patch mocks it out properly.

Change-Id: Ida7aaa7d085cc0316aa496d0a0e24333c5828cee
Closes-Bug: #1832829
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that get_host_ip() is mocked out in test

The test test_setup_ufw() didn't mock out get_host_ip() which meant that
the test leaked and used an actual IP hostname lookup.  This failed when
ubuntu.com's IP address changed.  This patch mocks it out properly.

Change-Id: Ida7aaa7d085cc0316aa496d0a0e24333c5828cee
Closes-Bug: #1832829

commit_message:
Updated context to use project_id

Fixed a bunch of deprecated warnings from oslo.context.

* Use project_id instead of tenant.
* Use user_id, domain_id etc.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 09:07:59.000000000', 'message': "Update tripleo-validations before upgrading the undercloud.

From rocky to stein, the tripleo-validations project has experienced
a big refactoring having some directories and files moved. When
upgrading the undercloud, the openstack-tripleo-validations is not
included as a dependency in the tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-common
or tripleoclient spec file and as a consequence, the package won't get
updated.

The result is that the undercloud upgrade operation fails because it
can't locate the tripleo-validations files in the right location:
No such playbook: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations/playbooks/
undercloud-disk-space-pre-upgrade.yaml

This patch ensures that openstack-tripleo-validations package is also
upgraded before upgrading the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ibfaa563a5882af0bff33b0e0cba92cb1b6a282fb
Closes-Bug: #1831041
"}]
commit_message:
Update tripleo-validations before upgrading the undercloud.

From rocky to stein, the tripleo-validations project has experienced
a big refactoring having some directories and files moved. When
upgrading the undercloud, the openstack-tripleo-validations is not
included as a dependency in the tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-common
or tripleoclient spec file and as a consequence, the package won't get
updated.

The result is that the undercloud upgrade operation fails because it
can't locate the tripleo-validations files in the right location:
No such playbook: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations/playbooks/
undercloud-disk-space-pre-upgrade.yaml

This patch ensures that openstack-tripleo-validations package is also
upgraded before upgrading the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ibfaa563a5882af0bff33b0e0cba92cb1b6a282fb
Closes-Bug: #1831041

commit_message:
Custom initial number of replicas

Added support to specify the initial number of replica sets during
runtime creation. If not specified, the number of replicas in conf file
is taken as default.

Change-Id: Ied839e7ab640b7e1678b781cd939ba3f3885f64f
Task: 23187
Story: 2003095

Thank you so much for doing this spec!
I have couple of comments and questions.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-22 08:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(15 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(12 comments)

A few summary points:

1) I find the VCPU and PCPU terminology slightly confusing since they're all virtual cpus just with different affinity.  But that's not a showstopper, I can live with it.

2) I think we need a way to specify *which* guest cpus are "shared" vs "dedicated".

3) Do we have a requirement to specify whether emulator threads run on "shared" or "dedicated" host cpus?  The only scenario I can think of where this might make sense is if someone had an instance that they really wanted to be fast with the absolute minimum of impact from other guests, regardless of the financial cost.

4) I think that the sum of VCPU+PCPU should add up to the number of cpus visible within the guest.  If we need to account for the emulator threads we should do it implicitly.

5) Do we expect the emulator thread overhead to scale with the number of guests, or with the number of guest cpus?  If the latter, then when using "shared" host cpus to run the emulator threads the overhead is essentially already accounted for in the cpu allocation ratio and we don't need to do anything with placement.  If the former, then it would make sense to allocate a VCPU in placement to account for the host cpu resources consumed by the emulator threads.

6) We need to figure out what we're going to do with instances that currently can float over the whole compute node.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-03-22 19:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

I have looked at this.

Pretty sure "pinsets" as you've described them aren't at all how the Power platform expresses things.  Normally I would red-flag for that reason.  But I *think* we don't care in this case, because we don't let you do pinning anyway (as I understand it, the platform does affinity for you, and does a better job than if you tried to do it yourself).  We *do* have the concept of shared vs dedicated, but we do that dynamically - you don't have to preallocate procs to either category.  We'll have to figure out how to model all of that in placement, of course, but I think not having to deal with NUMA will allow us to do something way simpler than what's described herein.

That said, other "nonstandard" (read: not libvirt) driver owners ought to look at this from that perspective and scream accordingly.

Also, I could be completely wrong about the above, so I reserve the right to change my mind later.

But for now, deliberate +0.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-03-23 08:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-03-23 10:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

This spec refers to the original change set proposing the rocky granular resource requests spec [1]; but it relies on semantics [2] that are not in that change set or in the published spec.  The dependency on [2] needs to be made crystal clear, including how that semantic is going to be used.  For example, it is implied, but not stated, that the "don't care about NUMA topology" case will use the config option / query param allowing the un-numbered group's resources to be "spread".

I'm still not on board with [2], and have proposed an alternative [3] which still allows you to satisfy the use cases described in this spec.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540179/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560974/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561717/'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-16 22:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-04-17 13:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-04-17 13:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-04-18 07:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@Eric, For the "don't care the NUMA topology" case, I don't see why we depend on this [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560974/", since we always try to pack the "NUMA topo careless" instance into single physical NUMA node.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-18 12:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@Alex

> we always try to pack the "NUMA topo careless" instance into single physical NUMA node.

That's the reason.  We still want to be able to land our instance even if there is no single NUMA node (anywhere in the cloud) with room for all the requested procs.  At that point, we need some way to say X procs from one NUMA node and Y procs from another (on the same host).  And if that doesn't work, split them further.  Etc.  The referenced spec mod provides a query param that will try such splits iteratively if it doesn't find a match the first time around.

However, we may be going with [1], which would mean you would put each proc in its own granular request group to satisfy this "any fit" scenario.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561717/'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Eric, so that isn't a thing we do today, so that is why I think it shouldn't be a hard dependence."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:09:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> that isn't a thing we do today,

Okay; I've just been getting the impression that it was.

> so that is why I think it shouldn't be a hard dependence.

If that's so, the spec should say that we're not trying to support that use case.  If we support the use case, we have the dependency; if not, we don't."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-27 18:50:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Namely, it's still not clear whether/how we're dealing with the "don't care about NUMA topology" cases.  The text implies that specifying VCPU:4 in the unnumbered group could get you VCPUs from multiple NUMA nodes.  That's either untrue, or there's going to be some change in the translation from flavor to placement qparams beyond what's being done today. I've got some questions within, but nothing blocking. There's a bit of attention that will need to be paid to placement with regard to nested rps, noted within, but for the most part this can "just work" from that side of things.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-04-09 17:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1
