(19 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-24 15:30:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-24 22:26:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

My initial reaction is that we've taken a step backward in both functionality and UX from PS23-ish.

The UX is simpler, yes, but IMO it is very confusing that I need to ask for vcpus when I want PCPU resources.

And I think not being able to ask for VCPU and PCPU in the same request is going to make it impossible for the CPU priorities spec [1] to use Jay's suggested approach.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649882/"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-25 00:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

(7 comments)

> My initial reaction is that we've taken a step backward in both
 > functionality and UX from PS23-ish.

This is intentional. This spec is waaay too complicated, as shown but how long it's dragged on, and I actually want to get started with something during this cycle. As such, I think it wise to forget about NUMA and mixed VCPU/PCPU instances for now and focus on the bare minimum of getting tracking of PCPUs into placement. We can build upon this after the fact but we need _something_.

 > The UX is simpler, yes, but IMO it is very confusing that I need to
 > ask for vcpus when I want PCPU resources.

It is, but ultimately that's a terminology thing. Unless we want to rename VCPU (the resource) to something like CPU_SHARED (is this a thing?), or go with something like VCPU_DEDICATED instead of PCPU, we're stuck with this. I think we can deal with it, tbh.

 > And I think not being able to ask for VCPU and PCPU in the same
 > request is going to make it impossible for the CPU priorities spec
 > [1] to use Jay's suggested approach.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649882/

As noted by Sean, this shouldn't be an issue. I'm happy to propose a dependent spec that re-adds that functionality but I really want to keep it out of this one, which is already bloated enough"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

i am more or less ok with this as it is.

there are a few bits that i might personally change but i can live with this versions so i think we should move forward with it and then consider other exetntion like mixing floating and pinned core in the same instance or cpu prioity pool separately after this is all implemented.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-25 13:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-25 14:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-25 15:30:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28: Code-Review+2

(8 comments)

good to go.

I don't agree with not deprecating the hw:cpu_policy and hw:cpu_thread_policy specs, but it is what it is. :)

-jay"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-25 17:03:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

(1 comment)

Just reply the comment which @ me. I'm also interested in reviewing the detail of how you isolate the shared and dedicated vcpu. but I didn't get chance today, and it is very late. I'm also in the travel to denver tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

(3 comments)

Okay, I'm going to officially abstain from voting on this spec, so don't wait for me if you want to approve it.

Alex tells me the prioritized-CPU thing doesn't need to have a VM with a mix of dedicated and share CPUs, so not blocking on that.

As for the rest, if y'all are happy..."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-25 23:58:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)

yea, no blocking from me also, sorry I need time get to sync with internal. Just one question about the NUMACell obj, I feel we should tuning the obj.  But if you think it is the implement detail, then it is ok. Also no point yet, I didn't review the full spec, since I need to catch flight morning. Free to go if anyone want to approve it."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-26 00:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-26 02:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-26 09:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-04-26 18:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-04-27 10:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(3 comments)

Thank you for updating.
Questions within before the voting.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-27 22:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-04-29 21:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-05-02 02:34:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I think I finally grok the overarching issue with this spec. Currently we're in model A where resource inventory is defined by two things:

1. the flavor(s) of the instance(s) running on a host
2. certain config options (ex: vcpu_pin_set)

And we'd like to move to model B where resource inventory is defined *only* by config options, and resource *usage* is defined by the instances and their flavors.

Currently, what this spec would call the PCPU inventory of a host is dependant on the number of instances it has with a dedicated CPU policy. Not helping is the fact that pinning is used for different things: a pinned CPU is a VCPU resource unless its instance has the dedicated CPU policy, in which case it's a PCPU resource.

I think we need to address this fundamental paradigm shift (buzzword bingo!) before we think about the details of config options and flavor extra specs.

I don't have an answer, but I think I've finally had the epiphany of why the upgrade situation with this spec always sat wrong with me."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-05-02 16:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2019-05-02 16:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

Currently the inventory doesn't depend on the flavors (in the sense that we don't modify the inventory depending on what instances are on a node), but I think the key is that we overload the "VCPU" count to mean both virtual and physical CPUs and rely on host aggregates to distinguish hosts intended for shared instances vs hosts intended for dedicated instances.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-05-02 16:25:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28: Code-Review+2

(8 comments)

As discussed at the PTG, we feel this spec is in a good enough review state with basic consensus on the direction while some details still are subject to debates.
I just feel we can move on and work on the implementation that could potentially show some design concerns that we haven't identified yet. That's cool, we also said at the PTG that it's part of the implementation pace, and we shouldn't just hold spec approval by being afraid of potential issues we could get in the future.

+2'ing the spec as of now accordingly."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-05-02 16:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

So I think my confusion was coming from not understanding that aggregates are for *dedicated* CPUs vs floating CPUs. That will indeed allow the "double-reporting and rely on aggregates to have allocations for only 1 kind of thing" upgrade strategy work. In any case, let's merge this and thing about it in smaller chunks during code review.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-05-06 11:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-05-15 09:45:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(2 comments)

it was pointed out on irc that we still have not adress the reserved value.
i have not remved my +1 but i think what is proposed in the spec is incorrect  and we shoudl adress it in a follow up patch.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-15 14:32:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2019-05-15 15:14:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

We agreed at the PTG that even if the spec needs some follow-up, it's still good to get it."}]

commit_message:
Standardize CPU resource tracking

We would like to both simplify the configuration of a compute node with
regards to CPU resource inventory as well as make the quantitative
tracking of dedicated CPU resources consistent with the tracking of
shared CPU resources via the placement API.

Change-Id: I9200c2b18369da8b9194a8ccbbf6f1baf6a9613c
blueprint: cpu-resources

commit_message:
Use Undercloud local_ip to ensure the registry does answer or not

The Container registry vhost should listen on the Undercloud local_ip
instead of the loopback address.

This patch gets the local_ip of the Undercloud from the undercloud.conf
file to verify if the image-serve service is working and answering.

Change-Id: I8c49001acdf33192d93113e5721f6e9b1aca73f1
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Sync package requirements from IPA repo

There were two packages added to IPA repo but not
here, make them synced as we are switching to use
this repo. Package list is sorted.

commit_message:
Support exposing ports in capsule - API

In capsule controller, process the 'ports' field and
convert it to 'exposed_ports' property of the container.
Right now, we process the 'containerPort' and 'protocol' field.
Under the hook, Zun will create a security group for opening
that port and protocol. The 'hostPort' field is ignored since
Zun doesn't expose compute host information. This might be revisited
later and implemented by the neutron floating IP port forwarding
feature.

Change-Id: Ic71d19c5e61573373babb5082331b98847a3cebf

commit_message:
Support exposing ports in capsule - driver

This is a driver side implementation of port mapping for capsule.
Process the exposed_ports on creating each container in capsule.

Change-Id: I901352aa39d40fafe039c96ece4ea45c92f3ffe8

commit_message:
Stop failing on missing memory or CPU

They have been optional for scheduling since Pike and are not used
by Nova at all since Stein.

Change-Id: Idd4d727d3bbcbb8898a0d989d3c496070bc41d8a

commit_message:
Switch functional jobs to python 3

As tracked in [0], functional job is the last one not running on
python 3 yet. With new zuul v3 job definition in parent, switch default
and create a tox target for python 2.7

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_stadium_python3_status

Change-Id: Ifb3b4e1bb7b20c77727d3371bc058ff2cff0c945

commit_message:
Switch functional job to Zuulv3 syntax

This patch switches from legacy networking-sfc-functional-dsvm job to a
Zuul v3 job inheriting from neutron-functional job definition.

Also cleaning up relevant files for legacy job

Change-Id: Ibe8254166cea4000d859f67c1e93eb6c5a743ec1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 09:31:12.000000000', 'message': "NumaTopolgyFilter dosen't work as expected as pci_numa_policy is 'legacy'

In NumaTopologyFilter, we set 'pci_numa_policy=legacy' and 'hw:numa_nodes=1'
in flavor, it will causes vm build failed when cpu located in numa1 and pci
located in numa0 in compute node. In pci numa affinity policies, 'required'
means allocated pci devices must be distributed at same numa node, 'legacy'
means allocated pci devices should be distributed at same numa nodes if
available, and 'preferred' is do not provider anything with stricter
affinity to allocate pci devices. But it dosen't work as definition in
practice.
I found a logic error in filter pools for numa cells, 'legacy' will use
filter pools but dosen't care numa has available pci devices which is same
numa with cpu.

Closes-Bug: #1832452

Change-Id: I4efb69490e3338f02cc81e21e557f2cedd7315c0
"}]
commit_message:
NumaTopolgyFilter dosen't work as expected as pci_numa_policy is 'legacy'

In NumaTopologyFilter, we set 'pci_numa_policy=legacy' and 'hw:numa_nodes=1'
in flavor, it will causes vm build failed when cpu located in numa1 and pci
located in numa0 in compute node. In pci numa affinity policies, 'required'
means allocated pci devices must be distributed at same numa node, 'legacy'
means allocated pci devices should be distributed at same numa nodes if
available, and 'preferred' is do not provider anything with stricter
affinity to allocate pci devices. But it dosen't work as definition in
practice.
I found a logic error in filter pools for numa cells, 'legacy' will use
filter pools but dosen't care numa has available pci devices which is same
numa with cpu.

Closes-Bug: #1832452

Change-Id: I4efb69490e3338f02cc81e21e557f2cedd7315c0

commit_message:
Cleanup percona rpm repo installation

Rely on the percona provided percona-release-latest rpm to setup the
repo in order to reduce risk of being out of sync.

Change-Id: I13ff4413d3a05f7df8dba942ae976e0f2544f8fc

commit_message:
apt: converge upload + apt_key tasks

This patch uses a feature of apt_key that allows us to send
a payload containing the key data directly without having
to upload it beforehand.

Change-Id: I4d0ce755461ae27018015dd63581ba9b64cf5122

subject: Fix dictionary changed size during iteration error with Python 3
messages: [{'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2019-06-12 04:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-06-15 06:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-06-17 04:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 04:54:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix dictionary changed size during iteration error with Python 3

In Python 2, dict.keys() would return a copy of the keys as a
list which could be modified. In Python 3 it is returned as an
iterator which can't be modified, so simply cast it as a list.

Change-Id: I0c955337b689ad2cbdb3975ca4f1ddd52e277a70
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dictionary changed size during iteration error with Python 3

In Python 2, dict.keys() would return a copy of the keys as a
list which could be modified. In Python 3 it is returned as an
iterator which can't be modified, so simply cast it as a list.

Change-Id: I0c955337b689ad2cbdb3975ca4f1ddd52e277a70

commit_message:
set ignore_basepython_conflict = True in tox.ini

os-vif sets the base python version globally in the
base testenv and relies on tox to pick up the
correct python version form the env name for standard
envs like py27.

This behavior only work reliably if
ignore_basepython_conflict = True is set.

Change-Id: I458cf6cf88d9ee672d6cce59e1d86ed888957042
Closes-Bug: #1832652
(cherry picked from commit e0712563c14755b734f9e109b1b864b45e6c6514)

commit_message:
Set default tempest_install_method for meta handlers

For non-integrated tests tempest_install_method is not defined,
so when python_venv_build tries to launch meta handler, it fails with
undefined variable. Once default is set, this will prevent problems

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665396/

Change-Id: I3cdfe48cae28969dea381bfa325c4bb4769fb4d1

commit_message:
Update qemu hook to facilitate Multicast

mdns AND IPv6 Neighbour Discovery Protocol use multicast packets
and the macvtap interface drops these packets by default.

Since there is no way to tell libvirt to make this better,
lets at least use the hook to make the macvtap interface
change such that multicast packets will pass.

With this, iPXE should work... and mdns should be testable in CI.

Change-Id: I397d211675fd7668b8fd19e989d740d6bad2c70e

commit_message:
Improve yaml output of "openstack overcloud node provision"

The non-default flow style is better at spreading the yaml over
multiple lines, which is better for readability.

Change-Id: Ibb0c6fb927eca279724cd18e4f8fc9669c02e957
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
yum: drop packaging workaround

The workaround for the missing unit file is no longer necessary
as the fix has been merged upstream.  This patch removes that
extra change.

Change-Id: I95c72e9ccb2a96f1956b0b4b8d82ec8d80b29fa9

commit_message:
Add section to matrix for Train driver removal

I am going to be removing drivers that have not met
3rd Party Testing requirements from Train. To make
things easier I am adding the section for documenting
these drivers to the support matrix in this patch.

Change-Id: I80c2fcd22b27cf19edc306ea2d9c4dc543418f39

commit_message:
Fix allocate_and_associate DB deadlock

In testing we saw a DB deadlock in allocate_and_associate.
This patch corrects that with a DB retry wrapper.

Change-Id: I20572505e448f9b7ff6314b5167cc4c519c445fb
Story: 2005893
Task: 33751

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 10:51:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues with Percona in Zuul and clean up a little bit

Percona site has connectivity issues from OVH hosts (of Zuul).
This patch makes it so that:
  - the internal repo is actually used
  - RPM GPG keys are downloaded from the actually used repo
  - Ubuntu mimics the RHEL behavior (i.e. the Percona repo is
    enabled only in the xtrabackup image)
    extra benefit: no need for APT preferences for Percona repo
    to spare MariaDB deps

Change-Id: Id27831f6b404762f9e44fd6bd1c4702bf06b05f8
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-06-14 10:53:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues with Percona in Zuul and clean up a little bit

Percona site has connectivity issues from OVH hosts (of Zuul).
This patch makes it so that:
  - the internal repo is actually used
  - RPM GPG keys are downloaded from the actually used repo
  - Ubuntu mimics the RHEL behavior (i.e. the Percona repo is
    enabled only in the xtrabackup image)
    extra benefit: no need for APT preferences for Percona repo
    to spare MariaDB deps

Change-Id: Id27831f6b404762f9e44fd6bd1c4702bf06b05f8
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit de58339a0e1704ae1ade4e032a73bb4708ecfaf1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with Percona in Zuul and clean up a little bit

Percona site has connectivity issues from OVH hosts (of Zuul).
This patch makes it so that:
  - the internal repo is actually used
  - RPM GPG keys are downloaded from the actually used repo
  - Ubuntu mimics the RHEL behavior (i.e. the Percona repo is
    enabled only in the xtrabackup image)
    extra benefit: no need for APT preferences for Percona repo
    to spare MariaDB deps

Change-Id: Id27831f6b404762f9e44fd6bd1c4702bf06b05f8
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit de58339a0e1704ae1ade4e032a73bb4708ecfaf1)

commit_message:
Reset MAC on unbinding direct-physical port

direct-physical ports inherit MAC address of physical device
when binding happens (VM created). When VM is deleted this
MAC has to be cleared so other ports may be bound to same device
without conflicts.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Change-Id: I9dc8562546e9a7365d18492678f7fc1cb3553622
Closes-Bug: #1830383
(cherry picked from commit e603d19939c98b94081bb6a3af8bcb943f7bd2ce)

commit_message:
Configure coordination in default for cinder when redis is enabled

Coordination is required for active-active cinder volume.

Change-Id: I9b26831fd951a24c483840a55824fae06ccbbf81
Closes-Bug: #1796615

commit_message:
Fix octavia-tempest-plugin releasenotes theme

The octavia tempest plugin release notes were still configured to
use the old oslosphinx theme.
This patch updates the release notes to use the openstackdocstheme.

This patch also enables the release notes to be built and published.

Change-Id: I7877854a86d4cf86614ec281b4840cef50abd4f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-16 09:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'Do not take ovs from git

We no longer use OVS new features, and the minimal version we require is 2.9.1.
Also, on ubuntu, the version that is supplied by apt is 2.9.2, so it
should be sufficient, and we can save hassle and time by NOT recompiling
the ovs ourselves...

Change-Id: I453dc1d38395015c2d24477b592d1a2ec212e43c
'}]
commit_message:
Do not take ovs from git

We no longer use OVS new features, and the minimal version we require is 2.9.1.
Also, on ubuntu, the version that is supplied by apt is 2.9.2, so it
should be sufficient, and we can save hassle and time by NOT recompiling
the ovs ourselves...

Change-Id: I453dc1d38395015c2d24477b592d1a2ec212e43c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 23:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add active/standby scenario test

This patch adds a tempest scenario test for active/standby topology.

This scenario takes a similar approach to scenario proposed in Change-Id
Ibcd5552a67cea650edc72bfaa986357267ca2407 with the difference that it
does not rely on amphora stats API. Instead, it uses iptables to log VIP
traffic and make assertions based on log messages.

WARNING: totally untested. Not ran a single time yet.

Change-Id: I24a6fc3387166ec6cdbd57a5ca9f63743748ec68

commit_message:
Add iptables-based active/standby scenario test

This patch adds a tempest scenario test for active/standby topology.

This scenario takes a similar approach to scenario proposed in Change-Id
Ibcd5552a67cea650edc72bfaa986357267ca2407 with the difference that it
does not rely on amphora stats API. Instead, it uses iptables to log VIP
traffic and make assertions based on logging.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I24a6fc3387166ec6cdbd57a5ca9f63743748ec68

commit_message:
Add pkg names better management between OS releases

The check-latest-minor-version role checks if the latest minor version
of python-tripleoclient rpm is installed on the Undercloud. But now, the
package is called python2-tripleoclient on RHEL/CentOS 7 and
python3-tripleoclient on RHEL 8 and it should be the same on the future
CentOS 8.

This patch fixes the naming issue across the supported OS.

Change-Id: If4aeeca507abc1aee3e783a25fb325e53152753e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make "Check if firewalld is installed" task quieter

Stop showing the task has having made changes and silence warning about
not using the yum module (which we could use for the check, but not as
easily).

Change-Id: I9e3608b5db521930409a29981767f468ea234679

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: allow to use unsigned repositories

When we run Debian 'buster' or Ubuntu 18.04 in CI job they refuse to
work as infra mirror is not signed.

This patch instructs APT to use unsigned repos anyway.

Change-Id: I530fde5b57894afda2de98d7c217e735497e3feb
(cherry picked from commit 5859180c2c78c62defca37446722b5f15fdbefb7)

commit_message:
use object standardattributes from neutron-lib

This patch switches over to use the standardattributes module from
neutron-lib's object extensions by removing the module and its tests
from neutron and using it from lib instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Icbcd17315f9a36b676f730b14fa2bac99c7d00b7

commit_message:
Add a PartitionTableNode to graph

Currently we don't have any synchronisation point for the partition
creation.  This means we have the "have I been called" workarounds in
the Partitioning object as a result of each PartitionNode calling into
it (see I35c5a473509f17a70270a2cbf5bf579faaeb123a for where this went
wrong).

This inserts a single PartitionTableNode at the root of all
PartitionNode objects in the graph.  We create the partition table and
attach/detach the partitions within this node.  PartitionNode thus
just becomes a place-holder for dependencies (i.e. the
create/umount/cleanup commands are blank).

Change-Id: I1b2af14791c5f6f65e52d05fb2724970cf75fb15

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-13 04:37:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix listing with --all error

When executing command "karbor xxx-list --all", it will raise
error as 'error: ambiguous option: --all could match --all-tenants,
--all_tenants'. The reason is we have both '--all-tenants' and
'--all_tenants' in the specify operations, '--all' matches two
args, so it can not work, but when using '--all-' or '--all_',
it return the correct result. We should fix it, so we remove the
arg '--all_tenants' which is not in the help info.
Story: 2005874
Task: 33686

Change-Id: Iafa70c35594af732435122ebd50c114fd7f0b9df

commit_message:
Fix listing with --all error

When executing command "karbor xxx-list --all", it will raise
error as 'error: ambiguous option: --all could match --all-tenants,
--all_tenants'. The reason is we have both '--all-tenants' and
'--all_tenants' in the specify operations, '--all' matches two
args, so it can not work, but when using '--all-' or '--all_',
it return the correct result. We should fix it, so we remove the
arg '--all_tenants' which is not in the help info.
Story: 2005874
Task: 33686

Change-Id: Iafa70c35594af732435122ebd50c114fd7f0b9df

commit_message:
Template show in cli should be by default in yaml

Templates are written as yaml so why not show them
in the cli by default as yaml. User can still see it
in json using the flag -f json

Change-Id: I17c5b26b8ef2a0ae02886dbf703c29434ad89781

commit_message:
Fix race condition when caching in debootstap

Currently there is the race condition in the debootstrap element:
when multiple DIBs are running in parallel they might want to write to
the same tar-file.
This patch fixes the problem: it creates first a temporary file
and then moves the result in an atomic operation to the final
destination.

Change-Id: I51a200151f5a6e404cb9f2cc151418c2e6f0dd85
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

Our sample configuration files are long. Really, really long. Make them
shorter through use of the summarize option added to oslo.config years
ago [1]. This turns a help text like the following:

  [DEFAULT]

  # This option helps you specify initial virtual disk to physical disk
  # allocation ratio.
  #
  # This is only used when initially creating the ``computes_nodes``
  # table record for a given nova-compute service.
  #
  # See https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html

  # This option helps you specify initial virtual disk to physical disk

  initial_disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0

Shorter, one line descriptions are kept as-is.

Change-Id: Iaa51b6a139fc9b7ffc97cd6881a9d49b29858b9b
'}]
commit_message:
Summarize output of sample configuration generator

Our sample configuration files are long. Really, really long. Make them
shorter through use of the summarize option added to oslo.config years
ago [1]. This turns a help text like the following:

  [DEFAULT]

  # This option helps you specify initial virtual disk to physical disk
  # allocation ratio.
  #
  # This is only used when initially creating the ``computes_nodes``
  # table record for a given nova-compute service.
  #
  # See https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html
  # for more details and usage scenarios.
  #
  # Related options:
  #
  # * ``disk_allocation_ratio``
  #  (floating point value)
  #  Minimum value: 0
  initial_disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0

Into:

  [DEFAULT]

  # This option helps you specify initial virtual disk to physical disk
  # allocation ratio. For more information, refer to the documentation.
  # (floating point value)
  # Minimum value: 0
  initial_disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0

Shorter, one line descriptions are kept as-is.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/commit/2f8025b22

Change-Id: Iaa51b6a139fc9b7ffc97cd6881a9d49b29858b9b

messages:
[{'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-05-28 11:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-05-29 09:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-05-29 12:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-06-03 13:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2019-06-03 17:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Before I sign off on this, what is the effect on systems when upgrading os-net-config and a new sriov_config.py gets laid down? If there is no impact, then this looks good.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2019-06-03 19:43:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Before I sign off on this, what is the effect on systems when
 > upgrading os-net-config and a new sriov_config.py gets laid down?
 > If there is no impact, then this looks good.

@Dan, Not sure I understand the question, but I can explain the reason for the change. When we introduce this change of the renaming the VF representor it was based on kernel 7.6 + Mellanox OFED. Mellanox OFED include advance features that only included in upstream kernel or rhel 8.0 (feature that call uplink representors). We never tested on rhel 7.6 or 7.7 vanilla which don't have the uplink representor feature. (this was mistake on our end). The new implementation should work for all vendors which are support or don't have uplink representor."}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-06-04 06:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-06-04 06:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

on second thought removing the -1 as my comment only suggests an improvement of the given logic'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-06-04 07:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Before I sign off on this, what is the effect on systems when upgrading os-net-config and a new sriov_config.py gets laid down? If there is no impact, then this looks good.

As of today, there are no active deployments with offload, so less impact on the offload scenarios for update/upgrade. But looking at the code, there are issues in one of the update/upgrade scenario, which needs to be handled for general SR-IOV deployment, as mentioned below.

Update/Upgrade with sriov nic configs and NO change in numvfs count, will work. And during the update, there is no change in rules, only the script file is update. As the script file re-written always, it should have the latest script files. 

Update/Upgrade with sriov nic configs and change the numvfs count, will fail the update. I have created BZ [1] to analyze it further and document the behavior.

So, this patch looks fine to me.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1716805'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-06-11 07:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-06-11 11:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-06-14 12:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch is being updated with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665108/, Can this patch be abandoned?'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-06-16 07:13:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

yes I'll abandon it"}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2019-06-16 07:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This patch is being updated with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665108/'}]

commit_message:
Take pf index instead of phys_port name in representors renaming script

In rhel-7.7 kernel the uplink representor doesn't have value
for phys_port_name so the matching will always fail.
So modifying the script to compare with pf index instead

Change-Id: I67d51a52d70369fbafdc59dd6936c0ae4ed6224d
Closes-Bug: #1830716

messages:
[{'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-07-10 07:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-10 09:10:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

well /etc/hosts is a universal thing so I think such a fix should be made in a common place so all distros can be 'fixed' at the same time."}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-07-10 09:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-11 05:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm tending negative on this because setting up /etc/hosts really seems like something that glean/cloud-init should be doing (well, are doing is probably more accurate).  I think it has been deliberately left out, @greghaynes should maybe comment more.  

We also have DIB_CLOUD_INIT_ETC_HOSTS in base, which I don't have much idea about.  I'm guessing it has been there since very very early but haven't looked at this point.  just as i'm not sure it's valid to assume people want this in ubuntu-common, that is also wrong in assuming that people would want cloud-init as part of "base"?'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-07-11 07:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Markos & Ian, many thanks for the comments. I fully understand your statements and concerns. Will have a look at the different bits you mentioned to have deeper insight and potentially proper answers to your questions.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2019-06-16 07:13:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I support Ian's view here:
also IMHO setting the /etc/hosts should be done (correctly) in a later phase (e.g. cloud-init)."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 07:54:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix /etc/hosts

Without this fix, Ubuntu provisioned images have quite
big delays when trying to connect to them using SSH
(and therefore Ansible) due to a missing or improper
/etc/hosts contents.

The fix is forging/updating a suitable default /etc/hosts
file according to other existing informations in the current
image (like /etc/hostname) and produces similar /etc/hosts
contents to what is effectively done in a standard Ubuntu
installation.

Change-Id: Idb9a90ebaea78fe5d5772186a5effffbb2704277
'}, {'created': '2018-07-10 09:10:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix /etc/hosts

Without this fix, Ubuntu provisioned images have quite
big delays when trying to connect to them using SSH
(and therefore Ansible) due to a missing or improper
/etc/hosts contents.

The fix is forging/updating a suitable default /etc/hosts
file according to other existing informations in the current
image (like /etc/hostname) and produces similar /etc/hosts
contents to what is effectively done in a standard Ubuntu
installation.

Change-Id: Idb9a90ebaea78fe5d5772186a5effffbb2704277
'}]
commit_message:
Fix /etc/hosts

Without this fix, Ubuntu provisioned images have quite
big delays when trying to connect to them using SSH
(and therefore Ansible) due to a missing or improper
/etc/hosts contents.

The fix is forging/updating a suitable default /etc/hosts
file according to other existing informations in the current
image (like /etc/hostname) and produces similar /etc/hosts
contents to what is effectively done in a standard Ubuntu
installation.

Change-Id: Idb9a90ebaea78fe5d5772186a5effffbb2704277

commit_message:
Add uuid for vfat

As described in the comments, the vfat index is overloaded by Linux
systems to a uuid suitable for use in fstab.  Add uuid generation to
vfat.

Change-Id: I293738b86b153926d8db51e69c3e8fe9361ed91f

[{'created': '2019-06-06 15:51:55.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use ansible for NetworkConfig

Use ansible to apply the NetworkConfig resource instead of the
NetworkDeployment resource. The script module is used to run the same
rendered script as NetworkDeployment. In the future the script could be
refactored into a more proper ansible role, but the first step is to
remove the SoftwareDeployment for NetworkConfig and just use an ansible
task.

Change-Id: Ie60ddb90562f9630c24711337473f9e3acdcf4c1

commit_message:
Use ansible for NetworkConfig

Use ansible to apply the NetworkConfig resource instead of the
NetworkDeployment resource. The script module is used to run the same
rendered script as NetworkDeployment. In the future the script could be
refactored into a more proper ansible role, but the first step is to
remove the SoftwareDeployment for NetworkConfig and just use an ansible
task.

Change-Id: Ie60ddb90562f9630c24711337473f9e3acdcf4c1
Depends-On: Ie543782569de14d56bc41740611f7512e8357a22
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

commit_message:
Add panko_api_cron container

Currently panko expirer isn't running in a separate container,
which results in events piling up in the configured database.
This change deploys panko_api_cron as a container and
periodically deletes events from db

Closes-Bug: #1832274
Change-Id: I4c941048a3561af9458208fe86e1b86156eb7ebc
(cherry picked from commit 66a638a8df8fa5b7c9bb92eb1e9da9d09c1fb447)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 08:06:26.000000000', 'message': 'Reset the stored logs at each notification test steps

This is an atempt to solve a new appearance of bug 1813147 where the
long test_instance_action notification sample test case logs too much.
This patch drops the logs of each successful test step to try to avoid
the overload of the logging system.

Change-Id: I0e5db9b2f423ab92ff93b6b3aada7d6b79a7abf6
Related-Bug: #1813147
(cherry picked from commit 93027713ab614b59ebb66f0617f85d43c956427c)
'}]
commit_message:
Reset the stored logs at each notification test steps

This is an atempt to solve a new appearance of bug 1813147 where the
long test_instance_action notification sample test case logs too much.
This patch drops the logs of each successful test step to try to avoid
the overload of the logging system.

Change-Id: I0e5db9b2f423ab92ff93b6b3aada7d6b79a7abf6
Related-Bug: #1813147
(cherry picked from commit 93027713ab614b59ebb66f0617f85d43c956427c)

commit_message:
Wire in convert_docker_params

This converts Docker*Image params into
Container*Image varients when using tripleo deploy.

In the future we can use it for a few other ad-hoc
Docker* variable substitutions as well to make things
more generic.

Change-Id: Ib1dc0c08ce7971a03639acc42b1e738d93a52f98

commit_message:
Drop poise-python in favor of directly installing python packages

The poise-python cookbook is no longer maintained by the upstream maintainer and
is causing lots of issues for the testing pipeline. Originally we needed this to
install a newer openstack-client via pip, but we no longer do that.

The one exception is in the integration cookbook which I'll be pushing a change
for that as well.

In order to do this, we need to include EPEL on RHEL which doesn't seem to have
any current dependency issues so I think it's safe to bring back.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/665493
Change-Id: Ic8ddf736193a6a7cea5372f2fd09e2def3634333
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

commit_message:
Dropping support of 42.3

42.3 will not be maintained anymore and therefore
there is no reason to test it. Users are advised
to upgrade to Leap 15, and we should do the same.

Change-Id: I51aded48166bbe7d5ff89f6037afe43638ce26e7

commit_message:
Reset MAC on unbinding direct-physical port

direct-physical ports inherit MAC address of physical device
when binding happens (VM created). When VM is deleted this
MAC has to be cleared so other ports may be bound to same device
without conflicts.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Change-Id: I9dc8562546e9a7365d18492678f7fc1cb3553622
Closes-Bug: #1830383
(cherry picked from commit e603d19939c98b94081bb6a3af8bcb943f7bd2ce)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 21:02:57.000000000', 'message': 'More accurate agent restart state transfer

Ovs-agent can be very time-consuming in handling a large number
of ports. At this point, the ovs-agent status report may have
exceeded the set timeout value. Some flows updating operations
will not be triggerred. This results in flows loss during agent
restart, especially for hosts to hosts of vxlan tunnel flow.

This fix will let the ovs-agent explicitly, in the first rpc loop,
indicate that the status is restarted. Then l2pop will be required
to update fdb entries.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1813703
Closes-Bug: #1813714
Closes-Bug: #1813715
Closes-Bug: #1794991
Closes-Bug: #1799178

Change-Id: I8edc2deb509216add1fb21e1893f1c17dda80961
(cherry picked from commit a5244d6d44d2b66de27dc77efa7830fa657260be)
(cherry picked from commit cc49ab550179bdc76d79f48be67886681cb43d4e)
(cherry picked from commit 5ffca4966877454c605442e9e429aa83ea7d7348)
'}, {'created': '2019-04-03 22:14:40.000000000', 'message': 'More accurate agent restart state transfer

restart, especially for hosts to hosts of vxlan tunnel flow.

This fix will let the ovs-agent explicitly, in the first rpc loop,
indicate that the status is restarted. Then l2pop will be required
to update fdb entries.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py

Conflicts:

Closes-Bug: #1813703

commit_message:
More accurate agent restart state transfer

Ovs-agent can be very time-consuming in handling a large number
of ports. At this point, the ovs-agent status report may have
exceeded the set timeout value. Some flows updating operations
will not be triggerred. This results in flows loss during agent
restart, especially for hosts to hosts of vxlan tunnel flow.

This fix will let the ovs-agent explicitly, in the first rpc loop,
indicate that the status is restarted. Then l2pop will be required
to update fdb entries.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1813703
Closes-Bug: #1813714
Closes-Bug: #1813715
Closes-Bug: #1794991
Closes-Bug: #1799178

Change-Id: I8edc2deb509216add1fb21e1893f1c17dda80961
(cherry picked from commit a5244d6d44d2b66de27dc77efa7830fa657260be)
(cherry picked from commit cc49ab550179bdc76d79f48be67886681cb43d4e)
(cherry picked from commit 5ffca4966877454c605442e9e429aa83ea7d7348)

subject: Drop poise-python in favor of directly installing python packages
messages: [{'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-14 23:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-15 18:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-15 20:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21961, 'date': '2019-06-15 21:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 23:00:12.000000000', 'message': 'Drop poise-python in favor of directly installing python packages

The poise-python cookbook is no longer maintained by the upstream maintainer and
is causing lots of issues for the testing pipeline. Instead, install tempest
directly using pip via an execute resource.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/665484

commit_message:
Drop poise-python in favor of directly installing python packages

The poise-python cookbook is no longer maintained by the upstream maintainer and
is causing lots of issues for the testing pipeline. Instead, install tempest
directly using pip via an execute resource.

Change-Id: I6991581056d6037eb269a6753b1af7e5c2ba7d90
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

Remove Neutron LBaaS support

The project has been retired and there will be no Train release [1].
This patch removes Neutron LBaaS support in Kolla.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/658494/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663875/

commit_message:
Add volume mounts required by Multipathd service

This is part 3 of a series of patches to properly deploy multipathd.

This patch adds a container volume mount so that /etc/multipath is
shared amongst all containers that interact with the multipath daemon.

Change-Id: I46e4afe4e63d80193ce9ec4df760a505a3e12ac0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-13 17:36:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix lower-constraints test fail due to failing dep build

Ubuntu Bionic updated OpenSSL package to new release:
from 1.1.0 to 1.1.1
It caused cryptography in version from lower-constraints
to fail to build in Zuul.
Additionally, constrained cryptography version did not
match the requirement for constrained PyOpenSSL.
This commit bumps the version to the minimum required
by constrained PyOpenSSL.
It works because manylinux1 (binary) wheel exists.
This version agrees also with upper-constraints for Queens.

Dependency on cryptography is removed as it is not used directly
by kolla (and requirements checker requires lower-constraints
matching version - let's not create an illusion of usage).

Change-Id: I8ae19f212049cae5dfb4e8dd6ec6cd14a8c46e0e
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 39a2cf066c4c79436629017155302d36243aa338)
"}, {'created': '2019-06-14 06:41:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix lower-constraints test fail due to failing dep build

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints test fail due to failing dep build

Ubuntu Bionic updated OpenSSL package to new release:
from 1.1.0 to 1.1.1
It caused cryptography in version from lower-constraints
to fail to build in Zuul.
Additionally, constrained cryptography version did not
match the requirement for constrained PyOpenSSL.
This commit bumps the version to the minimum required
by constrained PyOpenSSL.
It works because manylinux1 (binary) wheel exists.
This version agrees also with upper-constraints for Queens.

Dependency on cryptography is removed as it is not used directly
by kolla (and requirements checker requires lower-constraints
matching version - let's not create an illusion of usage).

For stable/stein additionally fix version of sphinx to pass CI.

Change-Id: I8ae19f212049cae5dfb4e8dd6ec6cd14a8c46e0e
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 39a2cf066c4c79436629017155302d36243aa338)

commit_message:
Make bootstrap more idempotent

No need to touch the sudoers.d file each time
Creation and mode setting is handled by lineinfile itself

Change-Id: Ia36e21b04d3a08fab3c748f6298f142c1d73ee6d

commit_message:
SRIOV agent: wait VFs initialization on embedded switch create

Check for configured and actual number of VFs to prevent
device registaration with 0 VFs.

Closes-Bug: #1831622
Change-Id: Ie699d245f8ae2fc1d16b96432d2962788d9dba57
(cherry picked from commit c148c6df468b3ee1a274f191fb4317aef2e4b225)

commit_message:
Add panko_api_cron container

Currently panko expirer isn't running in a separate container,
which results in events piling up in the configured database.
This change deploys panko_api_cron as a container and
periodically deletes events from db

Closes-Bug: #1832274
Change-Id: I4c941048a3561af9458208fe86e1b86156eb7ebc
(cherry picked from commit 66a638a8df8fa5b7c9bb92eb1e9da9d09c1fb447)

commit_message:
Fix NovaNfs role parameters

This I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e introduces bug
which breaks NFS for Nova. The NFS task in in host_prep_tasks
did not run because we did not meet the nfs_backend_enable|bool
condition.

Closes-Bug: #1832850

Change-Id: Id918080bf0817ce24eb4abe716a4f1b1375c236d
(cherry picked from commit 60248889a59957c1b323ce6a9859d56eb78cfce3)
(cherry picked from commit 247e8e86f31b48f85e849d242f3a31f99ccc7665)

commit_message:
Fix NovaNfs role parameters

This I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e introduces bug
which breaks NFS for Nova. The NFS task in in host_prep_tasks
did not run because we did not meet the nfs_backend_enable|bool
condition.

Closes-Bug: #1832850

Change-Id: Id918080bf0817ce24eb4abe716a4f1b1375c236d
(cherry picked from commit 60248889a59957c1b323ce6a9859d56eb78cfce3)

[{'created': '2019-04-04 18:49:45.000000000', 'message': 'Handle PortLimitExceeded in POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface

When attaching an interface to a server, if an existing port is not
specified, nova-compute will attempt to create a port on either the
user-specified network or the network that is available to the tenant.

If the tenant exceeds their port quota in neutron, a PortLimitExceeded
exception is raised up from nova-compute [1] which is not being handled
in the API controller code - which is fixed in this change.

Note that this is one of the few synchronous RPC call operations [2]
in the compute API so exceptions from the compute service will leak
back to the API like in this case and need to be handled to avoid a
500 response to the user.

The 403 response used here matches how PortLimitExceeded is handled in
the server create API [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6ebb2c4ca/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L565
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6ebb2c4ca/nova/compute/rpcapi.py#L489
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6ebb2c4ca/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L688

Change-Id: I5687480a22542eea31d299442837bd64bf731285
Closes-Bug: #1823203

commit_message:
Handle PortLimitExceeded in POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface

When attaching an interface to a server, if an existing port is not
specified, nova-compute will attempt to create a port on either the
user-specified network or the network that is available to the tenant.

If the tenant exceeds their port quota in neutron, a PortLimitExceeded
exception is raised up from nova-compute [1] which is not being handled
in the API controller code - which is fixed in this change.

Note that this is one of the few synchronous RPC call operations [2]
in the compute API so exceptions from the compute service will leak
back to the API like in this case and need to be handled to avoid a
500 response to the user.

The 403 response used here matches how PortLimitExceeded is handled in
the server create API [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6ebb2c4ca/nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#L565
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6ebb2c4ca/nova/compute/rpcapi.py#L489
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6ebb2c4ca/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L688

Change-Id: I5687480a22542eea31d299442837bd64bf731285
Closes-Bug: #1823203

commit_message:
Update quota known issues docs

This removes the old reference to the nova-manage
command to refresh quota usage which no longer
applies since we started counting quotas in the
Pike release.

This replaces with a reference to the down-cell
known issue for counting quotas.

Change-Id: I2765f3ca3dc95345d4e4c4db43ac3dff4a509259

[{'created': '2019-06-03 20:10:13.000000000', 'message': 'Configure nova to send versioned and unversioned notifications

Nova change https://review.opendev.org/603079/ is changing the
default configuration to send only unversioned notfications rather
than both versioned and unversioned notifications. This could break
unsuspecting downstream projects (like Watcher) whose CI jobs are
not explicitly configuring nova for the types of notifications
they need but are just relying on getting both.

Change-Id: Ied9d50b07c368d5c2be658c744f340a8d1ee41e0
'}, {'created': '2019-06-11 17:55:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add NOVA_NOTIFICATION_FORMAT variable

Nova change https://review.opendev.org/603079/ changed the
default configuration to send only unversioned notfications rather
than both versioned and unversioned notifications. This could break
unsuspecting downstream projects (like Watcher) whose CI jobs are
not explicitly configuring nova for the types of notifications
they need but are just relying on getting both per the previous
default of the config option.

This adds a variable which defaults to "unversioned" to match the
nova default but allows downstream CI jobs to easily configure
another value.

Needed by https://review.opendev.org/663332/

Change-Id: Ied9d50b07c368d5c2be658c744f340a8d1ee41e0
'}]
commit_message:
Add NOVA_NOTIFICATION_FORMAT variable

Nova change https://review.opendev.org/603079/ changed the
default configuration to send only unversioned notfications rather
than both versioned and unversioned notifications. This could break
unsuspecting downstream projects (like Watcher) whose CI jobs are
not explicitly configuring nova for the types of notifications
they need but are just relying on getting both per the previous
default of the config option.

This adds a variable which defaults to "unversioned" to match the
nova default but allows downstream CI jobs to easily configure
another value.

Needed by https://review.opendev.org/663332/

Change-Id: Ied9d50b07c368d5c2be658c744f340a8d1ee41e0

subject: Move pot file generation to venv
messages:
[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-05-15 14:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-05-15 17:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-20 10:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2019-05-27 16:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Training-guides POT build jobs are triggered from https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/prepare-zanata-client/files/upstream_translation_update.sh#L75 . POT files still need to be generated and upstream-proposed to Zanata. Python 2 -> 3 looks fine to me.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-05-28 07:48:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Training-guides POT build jobs are triggered from https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/prepare-zanata-client/files/upstream_translation_update.sh#L75
 > . POT files still need to be generated and upstream-proposed to
 > Zanata. Python 2 -> 3 looks fine to me.

thx for pointing to the job script, but I don't understand, why a pot generation is sometimes required and sometimes not. Where is that in project doc job? And can that be centralized? At the moment only this job is broken and needs a deeper look in generatepot-training.sh"}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2019-06-01 16:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> thx for pointing to the job script, but I don't understand, why a
 > pot generation is sometimes required and sometimes not. Where is
 > that in project doc job? And can that be centralized? At the moment

That just contains historical reasons - I18n team supported rst-based documents under Documentation team governance including training-guides. That's why the script what I linked shows some other docs team projects on line 55 (Also, openstack-manuals have similar job in tox: https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/src/branch/master/tox.ini#L75 ). Line 117-124 which we implemented targets documents which are not under Docs team governance. For the documents not under Docs team governance, generatepot stuff is implemented at https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/prepare-zanata-client/files/common_translation_update.sh#L431 where as currently generatepot stuffs for Docs team governance projects are implemented as such tox job. Of course, that can be centralized but different directory structure on openstack-manuals and training-guides (upstream-training) might be challenging I think."}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-06-12 07:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-06-14 06:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-06-14 06:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-14 17:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2019-06-14 21:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2019-06-15 09:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Move pot file generation to venv

periodic job failed since some weeks due the usage of Sphinx 2.0
in Python 2.7, called by the shell script outside venv

see:
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/opendev.org/openstack/training-guides/master/propose-translation-update/a09c131/

Maybe get job working again after some weeks.
Requires still a general patch for propose-translation-update to run
on Bionic with Sphinx 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I40a271bdc171ee7dc433178633c190c7bd1e8e5f

Add reno for removed cells v1 policies

This was called out in change Ib0e0b708c46e4330e51f8f8fdfbb02d45aaf0f44.

Change-Id: I1dcc1bb072c0f98deb42841753e3474ac510cce5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 21:42:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nova.compute.*API() shims

When we had cellsv1, we had two different sets of
[Host|InstanceAction|ComputeCells]API. Now that cellsv1 is gone, we only
need nova.compute.api.API, .HostAPI, and .InstanceActionAPI. This patch
removes the dynamic loader shims from nova/compute/__init__.py and swaps
out all references to directly access the classes in nova.compute.api.

cleanup for blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I84d9692efa3a131d6392dbd1011dfc43e4ac0b53
'}, {'created': '2019-05-21 22:01:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nova.compute.*API() shims

When we had cellsv1, we had two different sets of
[Host|InstanceAction|ComputeCells]API. Now that cellsv1 is gone, we only
need nova.compute.api.API, .HostAPI, and .InstanceActionAPI. This patch
removes the dynamic loader shims from nova/compute/__init__.py and swaps
out all references to directly access the classes in nova.compute.api.

cleanup for blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I84d9692efa3a131d6392dbd1011dfc43e4ac0b53
'}, {'created': '2019-05-22 22:24:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nova.compute.*API() shims

When we had cellsv1, we had two different sets of
[Host|InstanceAction|ComputeCells]API. Now that cellsv1 is gone, we only
need nova.compute.api.API, .HostAPI, and .InstanceActionAPI. This patch
removes the dynamic loader shims from nova/compute/__init__.py and swaps
out all references to directly access the classes in nova.compute.api.

Note that there are a couple of ways we could have done this. One way
would have been to replace

  from nova import compute

with

  from nova.compute import api

and then change

  self.compute_api = compute.API()

to

  self.compute_api = api.API()

However, the current approach was preferred because
- smaller delta
- the code reads better as compute.API(), which is more important than
  the import being pretty

cleanup for blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I84d9692efa3a131d6392dbd1011dfc43e4ac0b53

with

to

need nova.compute.api.API, .HostAPI, and .InstanceActionAPI. This patch
removes the dynamic loader shims from nova/compute/__init__.py and swaps
out all references to directly access the classes in nova.compute.api.

Note that there are a couple of ways we could have done this. One way
would have been to replace

  from nova import compute

with

  from nova.compute import api

and then change

  self.compute_api = compute.API()

to

  self.compute_api = api.API()

However, the current approach was preferred because
- smaller delta
- the code reads better as compute.API(), which is more important than
  the import being pretty

commit_message:
Remove nova.compute.*API() shims

When we had cellsv1, we had two different sets of
[Host|InstanceAction|ComputeCells]API. Now that cellsv1 is gone, we only
need nova.compute.api.API, .HostAPI, and .InstanceActionAPI. This patch
removes the dynamic loader shims from nova/compute/__init__.py and swaps
out all references to directly access the classes in nova.compute.api.

Note that there are a couple of ways we could have done this. One way
would have been to replace

  from nova import compute

with

  from nova.compute import api

and then change

  self.compute_api = compute.API()

to

  self.compute_api = api.API()

However, the current approach was preferred because
- smaller delta
- the code reads better as compute.API(), which is more important than
  the import being pretty

cleanup for blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I84d9692efa3a131d6392dbd1011dfc43e4ac0b53

commit_message:
Stop passing 'kwargs' to 'rebuild_instance'

The cells v1 RPC API is gone which means there's nothing setting this
anymore.

Part of blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I28016c134ebf745bc7a49cda9d80690019788a38
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 17:55:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix network rename + service_net_map_replace

If name_lower of a network is changed, and service_net_map_replace
is used. The subnet defined for the network in roles_data would
have to be updated to match the new name_lower. This was not the
case prior to stein, because roles_data did'nt include the subnet.

A downstream regression test is failing because of this. The
workaround is to update roles_data with a value for the subnet
that match name_lower.

This patch should fix the need to update roles_data in the case
that the net_map_replace matches the subnet in roles_data and no
additional subnet with this defined for this network in
network_data.

commit_message:
Fix network rename + service_net_map_replace

If name_lower of a network is changed, and service_net_map_replace
is used. The subnet defined for the network in roles_data would
have to be updated to match the new name_lower. This was not the
case prior to stein, because roles_data did'nt include the subnet.

A downstream regression test is failing because of this. The
workaround is to update roles_data with a value for the subnet
that match name_lower.

This patch should fix the need to update roles_data in the case
that the net_map_replace matches the subnet in roles_data and no
additional subnet with this defined for this network in
network_data.

Closes-Bug: #1832759
Change-Id: I10f99fad0f0016bf81edd53e1c5579f9d5c0ef88

commit_message:
Reset MAC on unbinding direct-physical port

direct-physical ports inherit MAC address of physical device
when binding happens (VM created). When VM is deleted this
MAC has to be cleared so other ports may be bound to same device
without conflicts.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Change-Id: I9dc8562546e9a7365d18492678f7fc1cb3553622
Closes-Bug: #1830383
(cherry picked from commit e603d19939c98b94081bb6a3af8bcb943f7bd2ce)

commit_message:
Revert "docker/compose: quote health-cmd"

This reverts commit 9fbbad559dcffaf4d57c5c1c244db3b80e09106c.
This patch was wrong. We don't need the quotes because
we use subprocess and the args aren't parsed lie on
bash.

Change-Id: Ibd97df51b7eede9c8c617777bd5255d075954db2
Related-Bug: #1824808

commit_message:
Fix NovaNfs role parameters

This I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e introduces bug
which breaks NFS for Nova. The NFS task in in host_prep_tasks
did not run because we did not meet the nfs_backend_enable|bool
condition.

Closes-Bug: #1832850

Change-Id: Id918080bf0817ce24eb4abe716a4f1b1375c236d

commit_message:
Skip ssh admin workflow with --config-download-only

The enable ssh admin workflow steps can be skipped when running with
--config-download-only. This saves time and eliminates repetition when
trying to only run the config download pieces.

In the scenario where the enable ssh admin workflow needs to be rerun,
the "openstack overcloud admin" command can be used.

Change-Id: I49b6eda6b87a3c306ab560ee5e447abe57ed79fc

commit_message:
Add region support for instance HA

Define the region_name parameter in the pacemaker resource to avoid
authentication failures in a multi-region context.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663022/
Change-Id: I00d4f97cd24f7c36eeb0a29f9c91422cf7ded3ee
Closes-Bug: #1831206

[{'created': '2019-06-13 13:29:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed mistral hanging processing the list of failed actions

Currently it queries all the records instead of filtering. Changed that
into a filter so only relevant action_executions are requested.

External bugzilla bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1718573

Change-Id: Ic8281cf47e587e193efda9dfa509abd16a1cf67e

Currently it queries all the records instead of filtering. Changed that
into a filter so only relevant action_executions are requested.

commit_message:
Fixed mistral hanging processing the list of failed actions

Currently it queries all the records instead of filtering. Changed that
into a filter so only relevant action_executions are requested.

External bugzilla bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1718573

Change-Id: Ic8281cf47e587e193efda9dfa509abd16a1cf67e

commit_message:
Remove extraneous references to RpcXXX parameters

Remove references to RpcPort, RpcUserName, RpcPassword and
RpcUseSSL from all templates that do not actually use the parameter.

Change-Id: I295a7ae93feda24a179a53158ecfc633721bcd59

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 935, 'name': 'James Page', 'email': 'james.page@canonical.com', 'username': 'james-page'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 9373, 'name': 'Vlad Gusev', 'email': 'vlad.esten@gmail.com', 'username': 's10'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-09-04 09:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-09-12 16:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-09-12 19:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2018-09-14 11:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-09-20 16:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-09-20 17:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-09-20 18:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-09-27 05:22:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

this looks like a new feature with a new dependency. isn't it prohibited for stable backports?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-09-27 07:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2018-09-27 08:59:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

>this looks like a new feature with a new dependency. isn't it prohibited for stable backports?

Well, this change might be considered as a feature as long as we agree to consider bug 1790598 as a feature.
This is not a completely new dependency for Queens release. OpenStack Nova stable/queens already depends on python-requests>=2.14.2

So it should be decided if this bugfix appropriate for stable branch. Does it contain user-visible benefit? [1] For stable/rocky this was already considered as appropriate.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#appropriate-fixes"}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-10-12 09:51:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> >this looks like a new feature with a new dependency. isn't it
 > prohibited for stable backports?
 > 
 > Well, this change might be considered as a feature as long as we
 > agree to consider bug 1790598 as a feature.
 > This is not a completely new dependency for Queens release.
 > OpenStack Nova stable/queens already depends on python-requests>=2.14.2
 > 
 > So it should be decided if this bugfix appropriate for stable
 > branch. Does it contain user-visible benefit? [1] For stable/rocky
 > this was already considered as appropriate.
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#appropriate-fixes

The user-visible benefit is mainly an operational one, in that TLS between the neutron metadata proxy and the nova-metadata-api can be secured with certs that use IPAddress based Subject Alternative Names.

This requirement actually came from the OpenStack Charms project, which is currently enabling support for Cells v2; this requires that the nova-metadata-api have knowledge of all cells db and message brokers so the existing approach of co-locating the n-metadata-api with the neutron-metadata-proxy which has worked OK to date (and does not required TLS for the localhost based connection).

However distributing DB and AMQP details to all compute nodes for DVR based deployments was not really sensible as it increases the attack surface of the cloud quite a bit, so moving to a centralised approach in the API cell for nova metadata services, with neutron-metadata-proxies connecting using TLS feels like a more secure approach.

The OpenStack Charms make use of Vault for Certificate management and use Subject Alternative Names extensively including using IP addresses.

HTH in the context of this stable update."}, {'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2019-01-22 13:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-01-22 13:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/599541/2 : FAILURE in 40m 00s'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-06-06 16:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@YAMAMOTO - requests is new for neutron, but not generally for OpenStack.

commit_message:
metadata: use requests for comms with nova api

httplib2 makes use of the ssl module provided by Python; under Python 2,
the ssl module does not support IP addresses as subject alternate names
(SAN's) which although an optional part of the associated RFC, is awkward
to work with in environments where certificate management approaches
rely on use of IP addresses in SAN's.

The requests module is more than happy to deal with this scenario; switch
to requests in preference of httplib2 for metadata proxy calls.

httplib2 is retained as its used elsewhere in the codebase.

Closes-Bug: 1790598
Change-Id: Ife4adf09ddbf7116da2f8596c80aed53fb6790df
(cherry picked from commit 7e0dd2f18d4919964655cfce7a282d1c5c131fc4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 00:43:51.000000000', 'message': 'Warn for duplicate host mappings during discover_hosts

When the 'nova-manage cellv2 discover_hosts' command is run in parallel
during a deployment, it results in simultaneous attempts to map the
same compute or service hosts at the same time, resulting in
tracebacks:

  "DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u\"Duplicate
  entry 'compute-0.localdomain' for key 'uniq_host_mappings0host'\")
  [SQL: u'INSERT INTO host_mappings (created_at, updated_at, cell_id,
  host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(cell_id)s,
  %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': u'compute-0.localdomain',
  %'cell_id': 5, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 4, 10, 15, 20,
  %50, 527925), 'updated_at': None}]

This adds more information to the command help and adds warning messages
when duplicate host mappings are detected with guidance about how to
run the command.

Closes-Bug: #1824445

Change-Id: Ia7718ce099294e94309103feb9cc2397ff8f5188
'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 01:06:45.000000000', 'message': 'Warn for duplicate host mappings during discover_hosts

tracebacks:

  "DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u\"Duplicate
  entry 'compute-0.localdomain' for key 'uniq_host_mappings0host'\")
  [SQL: u'INSERT INTO host_mappings (created_at, updated_at, cell_id,
  host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(cell_id)s,
  %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': u'compute-0.localdomain',
  %'cell_id': 5, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 4, 10, 15, 20,
  %50, 527925), 'updated_at': None}]

This adds more information to the command help and adds a warning
message when duplicate host mappings are detected with guidance about
how to run the command.

Closes-Bug: #1824445

Change-Id: Ia7718ce099294e94309103feb9cc2397ff8f5188
'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 16:34:45.000000000', 'message': 'Warn for duplicate host mappings during discover_hosts

When the 'nova-manage cellv2 discover_hosts' command is run in parallel
during a deployment, it results in simultaneous attempts to map the
same compute or service hosts at the same time, resulting in
tracebacks:

  "DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u\"Duplicate
  entry 'compute-0.localdomain' for key 'uniq_host_mappings0host'\")
  [SQL: u'INSERT INTO host_mappings (created_at, updated_at, cell_id,
  host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(cell_id)s,
  %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': u'compute-0.localdomain',
  %'cell_id': 5, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 4, 10, 15, 20,
  %50, 527925), 'updated_at': None}]

This adds more information to the command help and adds a warning
message when duplicate host mappings are detected with guidance about
how to run the command.

This also adds a warning to the scheduler periodic task to recommend
enabling the periodic on only one scheduler to prevent collisions.

We choose to warn and stop instead of ignoring DBDuplicateEntry because
there could potentially be a large number of parallel tasks competing
to insert duplicate records where only one can succeed. If we ignore
and continue to the next record, the large number of tasks will
repeatedly collide in a tight loop until all get through the entire
list of compute hosts that are being mapped. So we instead stop the
colliding task and emit a message.

Closes-Bug: #1824445

Change-Id: Ia7718ce099294e94309103feb9cc2397ff8f5188
'}, {'created': '2019-04-25 19:35:31.000000000', 'message': 'Warn for duplicate host mappings during discover_hosts

When the 'nova-manage cellv2 discover_hosts' command is run in parallel
during a deployment, it results in simultaneous attempts to map the
same compute or service hosts at the same time, resulting in
tracebacks:

  "DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u\"Duplicate
  entry 'compute-0.localdomain' for key 'uniq_host_mappings0host'\")
  [SQL: u'INSERT INTO host_mappings (created_at, updated_at, cell_id,
  host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(cell_id)s,
  %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': u'compute-0.localdomain',
  %'cell_id': 5, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 4, 10, 15, 20,
  %50, 527925), 'updated_at': None}]

This adds more information to the command help and adds a warning
message when duplicate host mappings are detected with guidance about
how to run the command. The command will return 2 if a duplicate host
mapping is encountered and the documentation is updated to explain
this.

This also adds a warning to the scheduler periodic task to recommend
enabling the periodic on only one scheduler to prevent collisions.

We choose to warn and stop instead of ignoring DBDuplicateEntry because
there could potentially be a large number of parallel tasks competing
to insert duplicate records where only one can succeed. If we ignore
and continue to the next record, the large number of tasks will
repeatedly collide in a tight loop until all get through the entire
list of compute hosts that are being mapped. So we instead stop the
colliding task and emit a message.

Closes-Bug: #1824445

Change-Id: Ia7718ce099294e94309103feb9cc2397ff8f5188

  [SQL: u'INSERT INTO host_mappings (created_at, updated_at, cell_id,
  host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(cell_id)s,
  %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': u'compute-0.localdomain',
  %'cell_id': 5, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 4, 10, 15, 20,
  %50, 527925), 'updated_at': None}]

This adds more information to the command help and adds a warning
message when duplicate host mappings are detected with guidance about
how to run the command. The command will return 2 if a duplicate host
mapping is encountered and the documentation is updated to explain
this.

This also adds a warning to the scheduler periodic task to recommend
enabling the periodic on only one scheduler to prevent collisions.

We choose to warn and stop instead of ignoring DBDuplicateEntry because
there could potentially be a large number of parallel tasks competing
to insert duplicate records where only one can succeed. If we ignore
and continue to the next record, the large number of tasks will
repeatedly collide in a tight loop until all get through the entire
list of compute hosts that are being mapped. So we instead stop the
colliding task and emit a message.

Closes-Bug: #1824445

Change-Id: Ia7718ce099294e94309103feb9cc2397ff8f5188
'}]
commit_message:
Warn for duplicate host mappings during discover_hosts

When the 'nova-manage cellv2 discover_hosts' command is run in parallel
during a deployment, it results in simultaneous attempts to map the
same compute or service hosts at the same time, resulting in
tracebacks:

  "DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u\"Duplicate
  entry 'compute-0.localdomain' for key 'uniq_host_mappings0host'\")
  [SQL: u'INSERT INTO host_mappings (created_at, updated_at, cell_id,
  host) VALUES (%(created_at)s, %(updated_at)s, %(cell_id)s,
  %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': u'compute-0.localdomain',
  %'cell_id': 5, 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 4, 10, 15, 20,
  %50, 527925), 'updated_at': None}]

This adds more information to the command help and adds a warning
message when duplicate host mappings are detected with guidance about
how to run the command. The command will return 2 if a duplicate host
mapping is encountered and the documentation is updated to explain
this.

This also adds a warning to the scheduler periodic task to recommend
enabling the periodic on only one scheduler to prevent collisions.

We choose to warn and stop instead of ignoring DBDuplicateEntry because
there could potentially be a large number of parallel tasks competing
to insert duplicate records where only one can succeed. If we ignore
and continue to the next record, the large number of tasks will
repeatedly collide in a tight loop until all get through the entire
list of compute hosts that are being mapped. So we instead stop the
colliding task and emit a message.

Closes-Bug: #1824445

Change-Id: Ia7718ce099294e94309103feb9cc2397ff8f5188

commit_message:
Ingress: Fix security context for pod/container

During armada bootstrap, ingress pod tries to execute chroot [0]
inside root directory on host machine to load dummy kernel module
and getting permission denied error.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/src/branch/master/ingress/templates/bin/_ingress-vip-routed.sh.tpl#L22

Change-Id: Icf7e29e95e0c3cf2bf71a22711a03218390c90cb

commit_message:
Add missing suffix-related docstrings

Review of I3fdd46a0a92bf9666696a1c5f98afc402cf43b33 identified
that docstrings describing suffix-related parameters were
missing on methods that had existing parameter descriptions.

Descriptions are added to make the docstring complete.

Change-Id: I8140e243b6ea32bb1ae2c61b163bfc8caa27d90c
